description:
Everyone benefits from having a trusted advisor by their side!

Integrity | Confidence | Relationships

I love what I do! In my work I have opportunities to make personal connections, to teach, to use my expertise, to overcome challenges creatively and to be of service; all things that I am passionate about and good at. All my skills come together to ensure your real estate transaction goes smoothly. If by the end of a day I’ve made something easy for you, it was a fulfilling day for me. You can trust me to stand by you, keep you fully informed, and make the process easy in ways that will surprise you!

When I’m not working you might find me…

·         With my wife and our crazy kids – they fill me up!
·         Enjoying the outdoors in Northern Colorado, where I was born and raised.
·         Lost to the world with my nose in a good book.

You might not know

I have been paid to build scientific equipment with Lego bricks, which makes me a professional Lego engineer!

Are we a good fit?

Certified Negotiations Expert | Ninja Realtor
Lego Engineer | Ft Collins Board of Realtors
Master’s Degree in Inorganic Chemistry

I was always told if you can’t say it best yourself, find someone else to say it for you…

“I unconditionally recommend Aaron Wolfe. Everything about the listing experience was high quality, and my home showed superbly. Aaron is so personable that everyone who meets him -- potential buyers, realtors -- like and trust him. In addition, Aaron was attentive to my questions, my conflicts, my wishes, always reminding me of my goals, not his. Yet, as a consummate professional, he gave me 'reality checks' when needed, backing them up with actual market data. He communicates. He cares. He knows the market. I wouldn't consider listing with anyone else.” - Susan F.

Ready to let me make your next real estate transaction easy? Let’s do this!

Aaron Wolfe | 970.420.1513 | awolfe@kentwood.com | nocohomes.properties
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, MS, CNE

description:
Purchasing or selling a home is one of life’s most significant financial steps and often happens during pivotal moments. With over twenty years of experience as a broker, investor, and property manager, Afshin has been guiding clients through Denver’s real estate market with expertise and care.

Afshin’s deep knowledge of the local market enables him to maximize the potential of every transaction. His commitment to exceptional customer service means he approaches each situation with thorough attention to detail, ensuring clients feel informed, supported, and confident every step of the way. Afshin believes a smooth transaction is a happy transaction and he makes it his mission to create a seamless experience for every client.

Having called the Denver metro area home for more than 35 years, Afshin is deeply connected to the community he serves. A proud graduate of Denver East High School and the University of Colorado Denver, he’s been immersed in the Mile-High lifestyle. His passion for real estate is driven by his love for Denver, the pride of homeownership, and the power of real estate as a tool for building wealth.

Afshin’s “client for life” philosophy means he holds every relationship in the highest regard, offering honest guidance and personalized advice to help his clients achieve their goals,  whether it’s finding their dream home, maximizing their investment, or navigating the complexities of buying and selling.

I’d love to meet you, let’s grab coffee or lunch and chat about how I can help make your next move a successful one.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Professional:

Aimee Twarogowski has been a top producer since beginning her real estate career in 2000.  She has won numerous awards both at her office and through the Denver board of Realtors, allowing her to be part of the Realtor Roundtable as well as a 5 Star Realtor Professional.

Originally from Washington DC, Aimee moved to Colorado after graduating from Rice University in 1986.  She began her career in Denver as an educator.  Aimee recognizes the need for professional development in order to stay on top of new trends and technology. She is best known for her negotiating skills and for providing the highest level of service possible.

Aimee's attention to detail and her knowledge of the Denver market have made her invaluable to her clients.  She recognizes the importance of property as investment as well as home.  Aimee is willing to spend as much time as it takes for each one of her clients to be satisfied.  As a result, a large percentage of Aimee's clients are referral based.

Aimee is a member of the National Association of Realtors, Colorado Association of Realtors, and Denver Board of Realtors.  In addition she holds the following designations:  CNE (Certified Negotiation Expert), ASR (Accredited Sellers Representation) and CRE (Certified Relocation Expert).


Personal:

Aimee has lived in Congress Park with her husband, Mark, since 1990.  She has two children, Fielding and Max, both in college. Aimee has enjoyed watching Denver transform over the past 20 years into an exciting, cosmopolitan hub.  She enjoys reading, contemporary art, movies, sports, and spending time with her family.

Education:

B.A. in English,  Rice University, Houston TX.
M.A. in Comparative Literature, University of Colorado, Denver, CO.
title: Broker Associate, CNE, ABR

description:
Alan Larson has 38 years experience in residential home sales in the Denver area and has been with Kentwood Real Estate since 1988. Alan earned his Bachelor of Science Degree in Chemical Engineering from Arizona State University. He has been a Realtor since 1984. He is an active member of the Denver Board of Realtors, the Colorado Association of Realtors, and the National Association of Realtors. In addition, he is a Certified Relocation Specialist.

Alan’s honest, no-nonsense approach to the real estate market has made him a top producer year after year. Of his approximately $20+ Million in sales annually, 85% comes from past clients and friends, and their referrals. His philosophy in his business is a straight-forward, simple approach, whether it is listing a home or finding a home for clients. As Alan says, “The purchase of a home is most persons’ largest investment and it needs to be treated with caring and professionalism. My job is to help my clients find the best home for them, while protecting that investment. And when it comes time to sell that home, my job is to get them the highest price in the shortest amount of time.”

Alan and his wife Suzanne have 3 children. He has a married daughter, Kara, who lives in Parker with her triplet daughters, his son Michael who lives in Highlands Ranch with his wife and two small children and Michael's twin brother Christopher who works and lives in Germany. Besides family, Alan enjoys traveling, playing golf and relaxing in the Colorado outdoors. He has been active in the Boy Scouts of America and Youth Sports Leagues, and is still active in several local charities.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Real estate is about making dreams come true through impacting lifestyle and building wealth for the future, what professional calling could be nobler?

Full disclosure, I love what I do. I started in the business because I love houses. I love the concept - where you rest and enjoy your life, is where your home is. 

This profession is so interesting and fulfilling because everyone has a different idea of what that is. I get the privilege to be involved in one of the most significant, emotional and financial decisions in most peoples lives. It’s rewarding to get to know my clients in this capacity. My job is to help manage the emotions of the purchase/sale through careful due diligence and expert advice. I love what I do and I’m very good at it.

I started at Keller Williams Cherry Creek in ’04. I chose Kentwood Real Estate, City Properties in ’07 due to a reputation of agent collaboration, integrity, and professionalism. I managed the Kentwood Real Estate, City Properties office from ’18 - ’19. I have a BA in Economics and an MS in Computer Information Systems.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
As a Denver native, Allison brings an extensive knowledge of the city’s neighborhoods and suburbs. Allison’s understanding of Denver’s history, paired with her expertise in the city’s current growth, lends a unique perspective to help buyers and sellers meet their needs. Allison is committed to providing comprehensive, personalized service that will best support each client’s real estate goals.

Allison is a graduate of Colorado College and the Daniels College of Business at the University of Denver. Prior to real estate, Allison worked for over 10 years at Xcel Energy and Vail Resorts, where she led the development and execution of marketing strategies, successfully driving significant business growth. Her deep knowledge of business development, brand strategy, and current marketing tactics - including digital and social media marketing - bring a distinctive skill set to the real estate industry.

When not helping her clients, Allison spends most of her time in the outdoors, skiing, biking, running, and playing golf. She also enjoys exploring Denver’s exciting dining scene.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
I am a 3rd generation Colorado native as well as a 3rd generation Realtor.  Some say I was bred to sell real estate! After graduating from Colorado State University with degrees in Mathematics and Statistics, I decided to focus my attention to detail and my love for real estate into a lifelong career and dove in to being a full-time real estate agent in 2001.  Buying or selling a home is a huge investment and you need to know that your business is in the hands of an extremely capable agent. In 2008, after seven years of selling, I made the switch to Kentwood Real Estate to align myself with Colorado’s finest and most productive agents and have loved every minute of it since!

Through the years I have lived all over the state: Aurora, Denver, Durango, Fort Collins, Franktown, Greenwood Village, Morrison and Parker to name a few! This has really helped to expand my knowledge of the metro area, and help others to find the area of town that is the best fit for them. I also own several rental and investment properties throughout the state. I have kept my finger on the pulse of the rental market and am happy to help those looking to invest as well!

During my non-working hours, I enjoy spending time doing photography, skiing, spending time with my friends and family, paying way too much attention to my dogs (Pickle and Jinx) and exploring all that Colorado has to offer! I have a daughter that is an ice hockey goalie for both Univeristy of Denver Jr Pioneers and SoCo Girl.

Together with Greg Yoshida and Zach Gilbert, we are The Move Group, Kentwood Real Estate!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, CNE

description:
Amanda Linville is honored to be a member of the award-winning Kentwood DTC sales team. Amanda realizes that the real estate process is a complex one, and that having the right broker can make or break a transaction. While she likes to think she’s seen it all, surprises are around every corner in this ever changing market. Amanda understands the value of anticipating problems before they happen to create a seamless transaction. Amanda’s goal is to form and maintain lifetime client relationships, and she does that by working above and beyond customer expectations every time.Amanda was raised in Colorado Springs, Colorado and Valencia, California, and is a graduate of the University of Colorado at Boulder. Amanda has lived in 9 US states from coast to coast and spent 2 years living abroad in England.

Amanda is a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors and is a Certified Military Residential Specialist, a designation she is proud of as the daughter of a United States Army veteran. She is active in the community schools her children attend and is an active member of the National Charity League . She enjoys skiing, running, yoga and family time with her three children!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Amy, an award-winning Realtor has provided over 19 years of real estate services with the past 13 years at Kentwood Real Estate Cherry Creek. Martha Potter-Goldstein and Amy formed the Dwell Colorado Team and have been working together since 2007. Amy is a member of the Denver Board of Realtors and has a distinct commitment to service, results and professional ethics. Her incredible network includes many satisfied clients and an expansive network of brokers throughout Colorado, the U.S. and beyond. Her breadth of experience includes working with Denver Metro area sellers and buyers relocating into the city, suburbs and all along the front range, luxury home buyers, relocation in and out of Colorado, investor buyers, and first time home buyers too!
 
This profession never ceases to change and evolve with the economic and political environment of the world and it is challenging balancing the advances in technology and marketing with the personal side of real estate. Ultimately, what makes me successful is my commitment to excellent service, results and professional ethics. I have an incredible network with many satisfied clients and an expansive network of brokers throughout Colorado, the U.S. and beyond.
 
I earned a B.F.A from at the University of Kansas in 2000 and promptly moved to Denver to start my new life. Shortly after I earned my real estate license and have never looked back!"
 
Working with Sellers & Buyers
 
Selling a home in today’s market can be challenging. It will take more than sticking a sign in your yard. You need an agent with a plan. Amy & Martha will use both traditional and cutting-edge marketing to find you a buyer. This includes open houses, neighborhood newspapers, postcards, flyers/e-flyers, etc. Your property will be advertised through a multitude of real estate and social media sites. A professional photo shoot, full-color brochures, and a staging consult are included with every listing. There are no short cuts when Amy and Martha list your home.
 
Likewise, when you’re buying a property in the Denver Metro area, you should work with an agent that knows the neighborhoods. You will need answers to some important questions regarding: schools, zoning, traffic, bus stops…Some neighborhoods are great for families, while others are better suited for young singles. It is important that you find an agent that knows what you’re looking for and knows the areas.
 
Whether you’re a buyer or a seller, you will find Amy & Martha to be honest, hardworking, and knowledgeable agents. Amy's personal goal is to bring a fresh perspective to an old industry.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Amy Stevens is a dedicated real estate professional with Kentwood Real Estate, driven by a passion for helping clients find their ideal homes and navigate the ever-changing market. With a deep understanding of Colorado’s diverse communities and real estate trends, Amy excels at matching buyers with properties that align with their unique lifestyles and needs.

Known for her attention to detail and commitment to excellence, Amy goes above and beyond to ensure a smooth, stress-free experience for every client. Whether working with first-time buyers or seasoned investors, she provides personalized guidance, offering a full-service approach that simplifies the complexities of real estate transactions.

Her vast industry knowledge, combined with a client-focused mindset, makes Amy a trusted advisor in the community—dedicated to achieving the best outcomes and ensuring satisfaction for both buyers and sellers.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Background: A second-generation native of Colorado, Anastasia was presented with the opportunity to become a realtor in 1999. Home sellers and buyers throughout the Denver area have utilized Anastasia's expertise. She enjoys living where she works, literally. Her Tudor in Park Hill maintains a close proximity to her area of specialty, the historic properties in Central Denver as well as the active urban lifestyle.

Working with Anastasia gives one the assurance that they are partnered with a professional that possesses an intuitive sense for knowing what her clients need and want. Lenders, realtors, and others involved in her clients' transactions know that she will ensure her clients are receiving the highest quality of service.

What Anastasia's client's have to say:

Sellers:
"Thank you for being absolutely the best in every way during the sale of our house. I could not have asked for a more professional job." Another happy client writes, "Anastasia worked very closely with us to prepare our house for sale. She knows exactly what the buyers are looking for and even brought in an interior designer for a professional opinion."

Buyers:
Anastasia's buyers say, "Anastasia's knowledge of the market was very valuable to us. She is a great negotiator not to mention she was a lot of fun to work with." "Anastasia kept us fully informed throughout the entire process, we knew exactly what was coming next, no surprises, except the champagne at closing."

Mission: Anastasia's mission is to create and maintain the confidence and trust of her lifelong clients through an interactive and energetic relationship. Her aim is to be acknowledged as a leader in her industry and measure by her high ethical standards, valuable market expertise and integrity.

Fun Q & A with Anastasia:

What is in your refrigerator right now: Home made tiramisu, champagne, tamales, fresh fruit.

What band dominates your ipod? U2, entire collection.

Do you have any pets? Yes. A beautiful and very smart German Shepherd. 

What is your bistro drink of choice? Dry cappuccino.

What is your favorite street in Denver? Sixth Avenue Parkway & Seventeenth Avenue Parkway in the Autumn. West Hayward Street in Highands during the Holiday Season.

Most embarrassing moment? Leaving my house in an old bride maid's dress headed to a Oscar party and running into a client in front of my house.

What is your dream vacation destination? Anywhere there is a beach!

What do you enjoy in your spare time? Traveling, cooking and gardening!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Trusted | Respected | Connected

Providing outstanding customer service through honest hard work is the cornerstone of my business.  I believe every buyer and seller working with a real estate agent deserves this.  Effective communication, knowledge, kindness & detailed execution is what makes a transaction successful.  Being diligent and problem solving without drama ensures repeat business. Treating all parties in a transition with respect and transparency makes me excel in my profession. It is no wonder that I love my job.  People are why I love my job!

If you buy or sell a property, you should have access to an agent that puts your needs first by offering amazing communication skills, always listening, providing education, utilizing the latest industry tools and providing honest hard work.  That’s what I offer to every client. 

More about me:

I love skiing and boating with my amazing husband and two incredible children
I love to practice yoga, run at Wash Park and volunteer during my “Me” time
I love the Denver Broncos and any performance at Red Rocks
Some people might be surprised to know that I lived in Krakow Poland during my senior year at college and was a game show hostess on a Katowice Television game show.
Are we a good fit?

Member of the Denver Board of Realtors since 2003

Military Residential Specialist MILRES

Certification to CP Yoga Sculpt

Volunteer at St Francis Center & The Delores Project

Marquette University 1990

I was always told if you can’t say it best yourself, find someone else to say it for you…

I absolutely & highly recommend Andrea Bell!!! She is so hard working, incredibly responsive, and has an impressive knowledge of the market. I knew that she was giving me the straight truth about any potential homes we looked at. I will definitely work with Andrea again on my next real estate transaction and recommend her whenever I can! - Chris B

Are you ready to learn more about the current Real Estate market and find out how I can help and work for YOU?  Let’s talk!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, MilRES

description:
As an avid horsewoman myself, I know you aren't just looking for any property. You need the right property – a property with the resources and space to enjoy your animals and let your passion flourish. 

Originally from Michigan, I have lived and sold real estate all over the United States. A job opportunity brought my family to Colorado but the mild winters, mountains, and open space have kept us here. 

After years of working in sales and management, I came back to my first love of real estate and horse properties. I’m now a certified BHHS Luxury Home Specialist and was ranked in the top 10% of agents in the country last year. I’ve helped my clients find the space and facilities to let their hobbies run, and make their particular real estate goals their real estate realities.

I specialize in land and horse properties but if that’s not what you’re looking for, I have the skills and acuity to help you find the right-sized space for your needs. I am a keen listener, a great negotiator, and I have the connections to find the right place for you. Helping a first-time home buyer find their first home is just as thrilling and satisfying for me!

When I am not helping my clients find their dream properties, I’m enjoying my own animals. I am a lifelong equestrian with two horses at home – a thoroughbred that I compete with and a mini that is learning to drive. Our small ranch also includes two Cattle Dogs and our kitty cat, Zoey. My husband Mark and I have one daughter who is a music instructor, songwriter, and performer. 

I serve on the board of the Northern Colorado Dressage Association and I’m also a Committee Member of Profit from Experience – a part of the Partnership for Age-Friendly Communities in Larimer County, working to ensure that all people have equal access to jobs and resources in our community, no matter their age. I write a monthly real estate article for the organization’s newsletter and am a resource for market updates.

Horse and acreage properties, and finding the right home, can be challenging. Whether buying or selling, working with a seasoned agent will make all the difference. I am passionate about finding the right place for you and your animals and I have the experience to make it happen. 

AndreaNoCoProperties.com.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Andrea sees her job as helping to fulfill dreams. “All the long hours are worth it when I find a family their perfect home. Maybe it has a kitchen window that faces the backyard so the parents can watch the children play while cooking. Or it could be finding an oasis on the Poudre River that my Buyers never knew existed.” A home, after all, can be in the lives of a family for potentially generations to come.

The key to Andrea’s success is listening to her clients closely and hearing what details are important to them. She constantly asks questions and never gives up. “I will write offers others may not think are realistic. I will go the extra mile to find out an answer and very often my clients end up with properties they may not have ever considered possible.”

Andrea loves helping all Clients however she has a special place in her heart for First Time Home Buyers, those Relocating to the Northern Colorado area, New Construction and Investment Properties. As you work with Andrea, you will notice her strong core values of communication, connection, confidence, compassion and care for you.

Community involvement is a way of life for Andrea. She is an active member of Harvest Church, serving on the worship team. And last but definitely not least, a proud aunt to an adorable niece and nephews. You will find Andrea enjoying dancing, biking, arts & crafts, music, traveling and outdoor adventures.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
I was born in the picturesque landscapes of California and spent my childhood in the idyllic setting of Colorado's western slope, specifically Grand Junction, until 1986 when I embarked on my journey as a Denver resident. My passion for real estate has been a constant thread in my life, starting in 1994 when I earned my Colorado Realtor® license, and it continues to thrive as I proudly serve as an Associate with Kentwood Real Estate City Properties, a journey that began in September 2000. I am a current member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors®, the Colorado Association of Realtors® and the National Association of Realtors®.

My introduction to Denver real estate was through various roles in administration, systems, marketing, technology, and training. These early experiences prepared me with a deep understanding of the industry's inner workings, which has proven invaluable in my career. With more than three decades of calling Denver home, I have cultivated an intimate knowledge of Downtown, and surrounding Denver urban neighborhoods.

My professional arsenal includes a rich blend of marketing prowess, exceptional sales acumen, and a comprehensive grasp of technology. I am equally adept at working with both buyers and sellers, seamlessly guiding them through the entire real estate process, from its inception to a successful conclusion. From our first conversation to long after closing, my goal is for you to never feel confused or alone because I can ensure you are in great care from day one.

My unwavering commitment to precision, honed negotiation skills, and a strong dedication to communication have consistently earned me a devoted clientele, who often become my most vocal advocates, spreading word-of-mouth recommendations. 

Beyond my real estate pursuits, my life is enriched by a diverse range of hobbies. I am deeply passionate about volunteer work, finding fulfillment in giving back to my community. Additionally, I am a culinary enthusiast, an avid traveler, a cinephile, a dedicated yogi, and a passionate host when it comes to entertaining friends and family. These interests, like the facets of my career, collectively contribute to the rich tapestry of experiences that define who I am. 

For more information on my real estate services, phone 303-489-1197, or contact me via email at andrew@kentwood.com.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Andy has called Colorado home for 10+ years.  He was born in Boston and has lived in New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, and Shanghai, China, before moving here in 2012. He is a University of Massachusetts, Amherst graduate with a degree in Finance and Accounting. Prior to embarking on a career in real estate, Andy was an executive for The Sherwin Williams Company heading up the Asia Pacific region based in Shanghai, China. Andy’s extensive sales, marketing, management and negotiating expertise has proved very useful in his real estate business. 

Andy’s passion for real estate emerged when he and his wife, Deirdre, starting looking for a house in Denver. He explored each of the neighborhoods in the city in order to understand what each neighborhood had to offer based upon the criteria that was important to them. After looking at over 100 homes throughout the city, they found a newly built duplex in the Berkeley neighborhood that met all their needs. Vibrant Tennyson St in the Berkeley neighborhood, appealed to Andy and after 2+ years continues to surpass his expectations. Based upon personal experiences, he brings this type of passion to the needs and desires of all his clients.  He realizes that making a sound real estate decision based upon facts and his client’s criteria is essential in the highly competitive Denver market.

 Since mid 2015, Andy has spent considerable time learning the Denver real estate market, understanding emerging trends and working tirelessly for both his buyers and sellers. He enjoys working with all buyers and sellers and strives to provide the most professional and personal service to all his clients.

When not working, you will find Andy skiing, hiking, or biking with his wife, Deirdre, or else on a trip to Hawaii or Ireland – 2 of their favorite places.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
The Difference is in the Details

Buying or selling a home can be both an exciting and stressful process. The difference in those two experiences often comes down to the execution of the many details along the way. As your Realtor, I manage the logistics and become your comprehensive resource that you can count on to make your real estate transaction personally and financially rewarding.


Our Mission Statement:

I specialize in the Genesee and the Greater Foothills market. My mission is to deliver my clients with unparalleled, customer service and professional representation that includes: implementation of sound pricing strategies to maximize profit, developing innovative marketing materials and special events, professional design and home staging consultation intended to minimize days on market reflecting in increased profits, to maintain a real-time knowledge of the community and home inventory to effectively connect Buyers and Sellers and access to our network of pre-qualified contractors and professionals that help keep the process on track . I always strive to exceed expectations to maintain a client base that is 100% referenced! And finally, to foster long lasting successful partnerships with my clients, to appreciate all that we have, while keeping perspective on the important things in life.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
This fourth generation Coloradan journeyed across the country before finding her true calling in the Denver real estate market. After earning her undergraduate degree from American University in Washington, D.C., Anne embarked on a career in digital advertising, serving creative tours of duty in Chicago, Los Angeles and New York at MTV, the Onion, Funny or Die, and a tech start-up.

In 2016 Anne returned home to Denver and bought a home in the Stapleton area. Buying her first home was the catalyst for her to join her father in the family business when she saw first-hand how challenging and rewarding a career in real estate might be.

Anne and her two sons enjoy spending time in the mountains, traveling and exploring Denver’s foodie paradise. Anne’s current favorite eatery is the downtown Chinese hot spot, Hop Alley.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
For over 20 years, Ann has successfully closed transactions for buyers and sellers in Denver Country Club, Cherry Hills Village, Greenwood Village, Cherry Creek, LODO, Castle Pines Village and the surrounding metro area. Annually recognized as one of Denver's top real estate producers and named to Who's Who in Luxury Real Estate, Ann has earned a reputation for exceptional service. Ann's continued relationships with buyers and sellers has resulted in her unparalleled understanding of the needs and expectations of her clients. That combined with her unique interpersonal skills, create an efficient and valuable experience.
 
Ann is a Broker Associate with Kentwood Real Estate.  Prior to joining Kentwood, Ann was with Sotheby’s International Realty, as an original member of Fuller Towne & Country Properties in 1999. 
 
Ann is an alumnus of the University of Oklahoma and Southern Methodist University where she was a competitive collegiate swimmer and an active member of the Kappa Kappa Gamma Sorority.
 
Prior to joining the real estate industry, Ann worked in Exploration and Production for the Phillips Petroleum Company; served as Director and Principal of the Riverbend Montessori School in Houston; and taught at the Montessori School of Denver. She has served on many community boards and committees including:  the Cherry Hills Village Planning and Zoning Commission, The John Lynch Foundation, University of Oklahoma Alumni Association, Swim Across America, the Cherry Hills Village Elementary School Accountability Committee, the Colorado Lacrosse Foundation, US Lacrosse and the University of Denver Lacrosse, as well as the Denver Ballet Guild.  
 
“To be successful in any kind of real estate market, you must start with the needs of your clients, always be committed to those needs, and utilize your experience to the maximum.”

description:
"My association with my clients extends far beyond selling or buying a home, it is about building a lifestyle, facilitating dreams, joining a community and creating lasting relationships."

She is a 4th generation Denver Native and has been a licensed broker for 26 years. She lives in the heart of Denver, is involved in the community and loves the outdoor lifestyle that Denver affords.  Annzo is a top producer and has been honored by the Denver Board of Realtors and by Kentwood Real Estate yearly for her multi-million dollar production. She brings energy, efficiency, strong organizational skills, the ability to listen and to navigate the complexities of every transaction. Annzo’s knowledge of Denver and the real estate market is unsurpassed, her commitment to her clients is first and foremost, she has strong negotiation skills and is highly respected within the Denver Real Estate landscape. Her peers know that she has the continued capability to make deals seamless.

Annzo has innate attention to detail, creativity, unparalleled marketing skills and a true commitment to her profession. She has worked with developers, builders and improved land sales. She specializes in Denver’s more established neighborhoods, including but not limited to Country Club, Polo Club, Cherry Creek, Hilltop, Crestmoor, Belcaro, Bonnie Brae, Park Hill, Cherry Hills Village, Greenwood Village and Castle Pines Village. Annzo looks forward to serving you.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Autumn Mestas is proud to call herself a true Northern Colorado native. She grew up in Loveland, Colorado, and ventured to Greeley where she earned a degree from UNC in 2012. In the years since, she has lived in many different cities in Northern Colorado, gaining an understanding and appreciation for each.

Autumn’s love for Northern Colorado is why she ultimately decided to pursue her passion for real estate. It doesn’t feel like work when she gets to share her love for Northern Colorado and help people put down roots.

Education and communication are Autumn’s two biggest priorities when working with clients. She is committed to helping you understand all of your options, and ensuring you feel confident in your decision because you have all the information you need.

Autumn lives in Loveland with her husband, Eric. She teaches fitness classes at Chilson Recreation Center and coaches at CrossFit Loveland, loves to trail run, and spends her free time with family and friends. Autumn serves on the board of directors for Berthoud Habitat for Humanity as well as the board of her neighborhood HOA. She belongs to the Fort Collins Board of REALTORS®.

Ready to learn more about Northern Colorado? Autumn would love to give you a tour!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Creating Results in Denver Real Estate through knowledge, professionalism, integrity and compassion, exceeding client’s expectations for a seamless transaction.
 
A Colorado resident for most of her life, Barb Fiest began her real estate career in 2000. In 2001, she joined Kentwood Real Estate in Cherry Creek. She is a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors. Barb’s most recent designation is Seniors Real Estate Specialist (SRES), where she is passionately serving consumers in the 50 and older market. Barb holds the National Association of Realtors Official Designation of Accredited Buyer’s Representative (ABR) and the Council of Residential Specialists (CRS) Designation. Barb is a multiple year recipient of the Five Star Real Estate Agent Award from 5280 Magazine.

Here’s how Barb Fiest creates Consistent Results in Denver Real Estate:

Barb has a very personal approach and always has time to listen. She believes getting to know her clients and their real estate goals, and at the very beginning establishes the kind of trust and team work necessary for a successful real estate experience. Her relationship with her clients does not end at the closing table. Barb's personal approach has proven results as demonstrated in successful transactions and client testimonials.

“Strong Negotiation Skills, fine-tuned over 18 years of experience with Sellers and Buyers, give my clients the edge they need in today’s fast-paced market. My clients’ best interests are well represented in each real estate transaction.”

Barb Fiest has Listing and Marketing Expertise in metro area neighborhoods including Cherry Creek, Washington Park, Country Club, Uptown, Downtown, Hilltop, Wellshire East, Platt Park, Southern Hills, Hillcrest and other suburban neighborhoods surrounding Denver. She currently lives south of the metro area in Hillcrest at Homestead, and has previously resided in Denver, The Hills at Cherry Creek, Castle Pines and Deer Creek Canyon in Jefferson County. Barb Fiest has extensive experience in listing and selling single family homes, condos and townhomes. She is also experienced in Estate Sales.

As a Broker Associate with Kentwood Real Estate, Barb Fiest is associated with a company whose legacy is being “Colorado’s Premier Real Estate Company.” With Kentwood’s unparalleled Marketing and Internet Technology, Barb’s clients and their properties are positioned for success.

Barb has two grown daughters and four fantastic grandchildren. Along with time spent with family and friends, Barb loves everything active and outside, especially running and walking with her beloved Golden Retriever, Remy. Running the Bolder Boulder is an annual event for Barb.

Barb Fiest’s clients appreciate her Personal Approach, Experience, Attention to Detail and Negotiation Skills. Her Compassion, Positive Attitude, Optimism and desire to keep moving forward through each part of a real estate transaction are hallmarks of her success. Barb’s goal is to exceed her clients’ expectations by going above and beyond.

For more information, please contact Barb Fiest.

description:
Belinda Cox - Your Accomplished Colorado Realtor

With a remarkable 20-year tenure in the real estate business, Belinda Cox stands as a seasoned and dedicated Realtor serving the vibrant Denver Metro community. A native of Colorado, Belinda's in-depth understanding of the local market, combined with her unwavering commitment to client satisfaction, makes her an invaluable asset to both buyers and sellers. Belinda started her career in 2005 working for John Laing Homes selling new home construction out of college.

About Belinda: Throughout her successful career, Belinda has established herself as a leading expert in single family and condo homes, focusing her expertise on delivering exceptional service and results. Her strong work ethic and comprehensive knowledge of the industry have made her an indispensable resource for clients seeking guidance in Denver, Littleton, Englewood, Highlands Ranch, Parker, Lone Tree, Lakewood, Aurora, Westminster, Broomfield, Thornton, Brighton, Commerce City, Castle Rock, and even Colorado Springs.

Client-Centric Approach: Belinda's dedication to her clients' happiness is evident in every transaction she undertakes. Recognizing the significance of buying or selling a home, she goes above and beyond to ensure a seamless and enjoyable experience. Her genuine honesty, passion, and remarkable efficiency have consistently earned praise from clients who have come to trust her expertise.

Unmatched Expertise: Belinda's experience encompasses a wide range of scenarios, from assisting first-time homebuyers to guiding seasoned investors and sellers. She thrives on finding those hidden gems that others might overlook in the housing market, skillfully negotiating deals that consistently exceed clients' expectations.

Noteworthy Achievements: Belinda's track record speaks for itself, as demonstrated by her notable achievements:
*Holds the distinction of selling homes in as fast as 3-28 days.
*Recognized as a top-dollar agent, consistently achieving above-list-price sales.
*Acclaimed for her exceptional negotiation skills, resulting in favorable outcomes for her clients.

Awards and Recognitions: Belinda's dedication has not gone unnoticed within the industry, as evidenced by her accolades:
*2007: Received the Sales Team of the Year award from the HBA of Metro Denver while with John Laing Homes.
*2017: Achieved the highest number of transactions award while working with The Chad Madlom Team, totaling 33 for the year.

Community Involvement: Belinda's commitment extends beyond business, as she values building lasting relationships with her clients. She understands the significance of investing in a home for families and dedicates herself to making the process stress-free and enjoyable.

When Belinda is not helping her clients you can find her spending time with her 13 year old Yorkie, hiking, paddle boarding, studying astrology, taking Barre Classes and shopping for the newest fashions and trends.

If you're seeking a Realtor who combines unparalleled expertise with a client-centric approach, look no further than Belinda Cox. To learn more about how Belinda can assist you in achieving your real estate goals, reach out to her today. With her guidance, your dream home or successful sale is closer than you think.

description:
Since 1977, I've called central Denver home, and throughout my real estate journey, I've earned my place among metro Denver's elite high-volume producing real estate agents. My primary focus today revolves around the resale of residential properties, and my expertise extends far and wide across central Denver's vibrant neighborhoods. Whether I'm representing buyers or sellers in transactions involving homes, condos, lofts, or new residential developments, my in-depth knowledge and commitment shines through.

My passion for real estate is unwavering, and year after year, I consistently achieve multimillion-dollar production, instilling confidence in both buyers and sellers as they navigate the real estate market.

My real estate journey began in 2000 when I collaborated with listing brokers on the ambitious 94-unit Water Tower Loft Project in LoDo's Central Platte Valley. This experience, tied to one of downtown's most successful projects, provided me with invaluable insights and expertise. In April 2002, I made the transition from a corporate career in sales and marketing to embrace real estate full-time. In my first year, I proudly received the prestigious Denver Board of Realtors "Rookie of the Year" Award.

Throughout the years, I've had the privilege of assisting developers on numerous projects, including listing Phase 2 of Fireclay in the Ballpark neighborhood, Phase 2 of Aria in Chaffee Park, Traverse townhomes in Curtis Park, and various other townhome and multifamily projects throughout central Denver.

My unwavering dedication, coupled with my extensive experience and achievements, continues to drive my commitment to serving the diverse real estate needs of this remarkable city.

description:
Bobby Bolyard is a dynamic commercial real estate broker based in Denver, known for his comprehensive understanding of the market and his ability to deliver exceptional results for his clients. A proud alumnus of the Daniels College of Business at the University of Denver, Bobby earned his Bachelor's degree in Business Management, with minors in both Real Estate and Entrepreneurship. This solid educational foundation has equipped him with a robust set of skills and a deep understanding of the business landscape, which he leverages to navigate the complexities of the commercial real estate sector. Bobby's passion for real estate, combined with his entrepreneurial spirit and dedication to continuous learning, makes him a valuable asset to any client looking to navigate the commercial real estate market in Denver. Whether working with investors, landlords, or tenants, Bobby is committed to achieving optimal outcomes and building lasting relationships based on trust, integrity, and unparalleled service.

Bobby's journey in the professional world began with a significant role as a Financial Planning and Analysis Intern at Progress Residential. During his tenure there, he honed his data analysis skills, contributing to the company's strategic goals and financial performance through meticulous analysis and insightful recommendations. This experience not only solidified his analytical abilities but also enhanced his understanding of financial planning within the fast-paced real estate market. Prior to his role at Progress Residential, Bobby amassed a wealth of experience across various industries, including property management, pharmaceuticals, and real estate analysis. These diverse opportunities allowed him to develop a versatile skill set, with strong organizational, communication, and analytical skills at the forefront. His multifaceted background provides him with a unique perspective on real estate investment and management, enabling him to offer tailored advice and solutions that meet the specific needs of his clients.

Bobby thrives on staying active and embracing Colorado’s great outdoors, with countless hours dedicated to conquering ski slopes. His spirit of adventure leads him into the heart of the backcountry, where he relishes the challenge of surpassing his own boundaries. Traveling is another passion, offering the unique opportunity to experience diverse cultures and communities, with summer fishing trips adding a tranquil contrast to his adventurous pursuits. At the heart of it all, it's the relationships and interactions with people that infuse his life with meaning and joy, driving his continuous search for new experiences and connections.

Phone – 504.669.7841

Email – BobbyB@kentwoodcommercial.com

description:
Bob is a 3rd generation Denver native and has been selling real estate in the Denver metro area since 1978.  He has a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of Colorado in Real Estate and Finance.  He also has earned his GRI, CRS and is a certified relocation specialist.  Bob has sold over 3,000 homes and has been the recipient of many local and national sales awards.  But Bob is not about the accolades.  

His philosophy is “Nobody cares how much you know, until they know how much you care”.  He has built his career on honesty and knowledge of the real estate market, and the tenacious ability to negotiate for his clients.

Bob and his wife, Mary Kay, have been married for over 47 years and have 4 boys.  He has served on many boards for businesses and community organizations, and has coached junior and senior high school basketball for over 14 years.
title: Broker Associate, GRI, CRS

description:
After leaving the Governor’s Office in January of 2007, Bob Lee went back to the private sector doing that which he began 20 years earlier…brokering real estate transactions. Joining his wife Nancy at Kentwood Real Estate allowed Bob to again be part of one of the metro Denver areas most dynamic real estate teams. Since 1987 the Lee Team has helped friends and clients buy and sell over 1,100 homes.

In March of 2004, Bob Lee was appointed Secretary of the Cabinet and Chief of Staff to Governor Bill Owens. During the ensuing 3 years he functioned as the chief operating officer for the State of Colorado. He was responsible for developing and leading a talented team of budget and policy advisors and for managing the State’s senior executives. As the Governor’s principal advisor, Lee was charged with implementing policy and working to achieve consensus between the Executive Branch and the Legislature on major pieces of legislation.

Prior to that appointment, Lee served as Director of the Colorado Office of Economic Development and International Trade; a post that he held since July 2000. In that position he served as a member of the Governor’s Cabinet and oversaw a wide range of economic development activities, which included domestic and international business development, small business programs, as well as the Colorado Tourism Office, the Motion Picture and Television Commission and the Colorado Economic Development Commission. Lee served as a member of the Governor’s Commission on Science and Technology, and as the Governor’s designee on the Colorado Economic Development Commission and the Governor’s Financial Review Committee. Additionally, he chaired the Motion Picture and Television Commission Advisory Board and was a member of the World Trade Center Board of Directors and the Economic Developers’ Council of Colorado.

Prior to joining the Owens’ Administration, Lee was an active member of the Denver real estate community. In 1995, he became part owner of RE/MAX Classic, an office which grew to 65 agents and was ranked among the metro area’s top producing firms.

In the early 1980s, Lee served as campaign manager for a number of Colorado political candidates. Among them was Apollo 13 astronaut, Jack Swigert, who went on to win election in Colorado’s Sixth Congressional District. In 1983, Lee received a White House appointment in the Reagan Administration and served as one of two Deputy Directors in the Region VIII office of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. Following a three-year stint at HHS, he entered the world of investment real estate where, as a partner and Managing Director of RMI Capital Management, his company invested almost $250 million on behalf of pension clients in the western United States.

Lee is an active community leader. In 2016, Governor Hickenlooper appointed him to a fourth term on the Board of Directors of the Denver Metropolitan Major League Baseball Stadium District.  Lee formerly served as Vice Chairman of the Governor's Drug Control and System Improvement Board. He is a past Chairman of the Board of Directors of the South Metro Denver Chamber of Commerce. He is a graduate of Regis University, where he earned a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Administration.

description:
Brandon Brennick is an agent at Kentwood Real Estate Denver Tech Center (DTC), where he started his career as a Broker in 1999. One of Denver’s top real estate brokers since joining The Kentwood Company, Brandon has received the Denver Metro Association of Realtors Excellence Award 20 years in a row with over $400,000,000 in production.  Brandon now specializes in management and mentoring agents seeking to bring their business into the mid to high end markets. His passions are in contractual negotiations, presentation strategy and derivatives which are things Brandon truly loves to share and hone with his 70+ agents.

Raised in Evergreen, Colorado, and a graduate of the University of Colorado in Boulder, Brandon understands the Colorado real estate market and its trajectory. Brandon also serves as the President of Real Estate for Pike Grain Company, Inc., where he oversees acquisition and disposition of all real estate and farm holdings in Colorado, Missouri, Utah and Arizona. He also serves on the Board for the Luxury Home Tour of Colorado. 

Brandon and his wife Kelly have two children, Andrew and Piper, and he credits his family and friends for his success. An avid sports fan, Brandon grew up playing competitive soccer, golf and tennis, and has coached both soccer and baseball. When he’s not helping real estate clients, you’ll find him at a Broncos game, on the golf course, at a live concert, or fishing in Colorado’s backcountry.

description:
With over two decades of sales experience and a specialized focus on real estate investment and development, Brendan Gustafson has become one of Colorado’s most trusted Realtors®. His passion for real estate is driven by a belief in its power to create multi-generational wealth, enabling families and individuals to secure their financial future. Brendan’s deep understanding of local market trends, paired with his marketing expertise and sharp negotiation skills, consistently helps clients achieve the highest returns on their real estate investments.

Beyond his role as a Realtor®, Brendan is an active investor and developer. His personal portfolio of rental properties extends across a range of vibrant Colorado communities, including Golden, West Wash Park, LoDo, West Colfax, Edgewater, Lakewood, Coal Creek Canyon, Silverthorne, and Breckenridge. He is also developing custom homes in sought-after neighborhoods like Wash Park, Wheat Ridge, and Applewood. Whether clients are looking to buy, sell, invest, or build, Brendan’s expert guidance transforms their vision into reality, navigating every step with precision and care.

A resident of the scenic Applewood neighborhood in Golden, Brendan lives with his wife, daughter, and two dogs. When he’s not working, he embraces the Colorado lifestyle through activities like golfing, skiing, snowboarding, mountain hikes, and cheering on local sports teams. His passion for the outdoors and the vibrant Colorado culture is reflected in his real estate practice, where he helps clients not only find homes but also embrace the unique lifestyle that the state offers.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Brent Gilles understands the difference between finding clients a house and finding them a home. The fundamental distinction, he believes, is that while there may be lots of houses to consider in a given market, only a handful may truly satisfy the needs and desires of his client. For Brent, his reputation as a highly respected realtor is less about location, location, location, and more about experience, experience, experience. His 28 years spent working in real estate enables him to think outside the box, structuring deals and transactions that help his clients feel great about their experience and know they have made a solid decision. Whether he is showing someone 5 homes or 50, Brent brings enthusiasm and passion to every client. 

Brent prides himself on working diligently to make sure everyone -- family, friend, client or even someone he’s just met -- is made to feel important. Putting others first, he believes, brings happiness and success to all, a key factor that brings him a steady base of referrals and repeat clients. He has experienced a wide spectrum of market conditions during his 28 years as a residential broker and imparts that vast knowledge to his clients. Brent’s enthusiasm for his profession stems from the belief that every day is different, and every transaction is unique, beginning with a client’s wants, needs and ultimately their goals. He uses his strong knowledge of current market conditions to successfully navigate transactions in a professional and thoughtful manner. 

A Colorado native, Brent is well-versed in the unique neighborhoods that are part and parcel of the Denver metro area. His familiarity with Denver and surrounding suburbs helps him match clients with areas that best suit their needs, and he works tirelessly to help them find the perfect home that will serve them now and in the future. His clients appreciate his candor, and he will not hesitate to point out aspects of a home they may not recognize, discussing pros and cons to ensure they have as much information as possible. “I’m a real people person and I take the time to listen and understand what is best for my client,” Brent says. “My goal is for every client to understand how we can together successfully meet their expectations. My clients value my honesty and know I will never encourage them to consider a property that is not aligned with their wants, needs and goals.” 

An avid skier, Brent clicked into his first pair of skis at age three and could not get enough of the sport and gratitude for the surroundings.  Eventually the passion for skiing and particularly moguls led to competing for the Winter Park Freestyle Ski Team.  He also enjoys golf, tennis, volleyball, pickleball and loves to take advantage of Colorado’s endless outdoor activities!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
What do you value in a real estate professional?  Market knowledge?  Industry knowledge?  Negotiation skills?  Zealous, yet ethical representation of you and your needs?

Real estate transactions are often the most significant financial endeavors in our lives, and they are becoming much more complicated with high risks leading to great rewards.  You deserve to have a seasoned, highly trained real estate adviser representing your interests.  With my broad and diverse background in real estate practice and transactions, know that your goals are my duties.  While I work within a diverse portfolio of real estate sectors, my specialties are luxury sales and relocation of healthcare executives and physicians.

Real estate and community are two passions I learned from my late mother, who taught our family that investing in housing could create financial and mental security where there had been none.

Being a native of Boulder, Colorado provides me with a valuable depth of knowledge about the real estate market in this special and unique portion of the state. Clients appreciate that I quickly distill their needs and desires into a bespoke solution. Years living and working in the Boulder area provide expertise that extends from the broad array of communities and neighborhoods in the Boulder Valley, to an understanding of construction techniques, to an ability to analyze current market information and strength in negotiating complex transactions.

It’s been my pleasure and privilege to have worked in international markets and with global clientele along with my many years as a Boulder Valley real estate specialist. This experience provides a unique perspective on the importance of home ownership and community involvement. I find that I am naturally inquisitive and love to share my hometown with newcomers, relocating families, and first-time buyers. My deep experience in the luxury market parlays into a love of helping those new to the area gain their footing as locals.

Being a “local” for me extends to my love of the magical outdoors that are the essence of Colorado – fly fishing, mountaineering, cycling, hiking, skiing, and exploring with my amazing Lab/Weimaraner “Sebastian.” I enjoy exploring the best restaurants and entertainment in the area, and sharing that knowledge with my clients. My affiliation with Kentwood Real Estate combines my fondness for a local brand that has a strong market presence throughout Colorado’s Front Range. My perspective is that Kentwood has an incredibly deep and solid reputation in both the real estate community and the buyer/seller/homeowner community.

Membership in Luxury Portfolio International, Who’s Who in Luxury Real Estate, and Leading Real Estate Companies of the World has provided additional support for marketing my properties nationally and globally, and to gain broader market knowledge and understanding. These affiliations provide access to the best real estate professionals around the world.

Committed to improving the profession, I have spent many years in leadership roles.  I served as 2023 Chairman of BOLO REALTORS, the Boulder Valley’s REALTOR association, and am a member of the 2024 BOLO Leadership team. As a BOLO board member, my goal is to raise the bar of professionalism for members, which in turn benefits consumers.  I am past Chairman of the Boulder Area REALTOR Association and have received multiple awards as a 5-Star Real Estate Professional and top producer. As a Certified Negotiation Expert and a Ninja Selling coach and trainer I strive to improve the professionalism of my colleagues. My desire to help our communities extends to my charitable giving. I donate a portion of my commissions to Food Bank of the Rockies; and to World Bicycle Relief, which provides cargo bicycles and mechanical support to remote villages in Africa.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, Certified Negotiation Expert

description:

description:
With a diverse professional background and a passion for helping others, Brian Devlin brings a unique and well-rounded perspective to the world of real estate. Holding a degree in Philosophy, Brian has developed a strong foundation in critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication—skills that seamlessly translate into his real estate practice.

Before entering the real estate industry, Brian built a successful career in both retail management and home medical operations and logistics management. These roles honed his ability to identify market trends, maintain financial responsibility, and lead large teams with integrity. His experience managing complex logistics and client relationships gives him a distinct edge in navigating the fast-paced, detail-oriented nature of real estate transactions.

Originally rooted in the Thornton and Erie areas of Colorado, Brian’s success in business led to multiple transfers across several states, including Minnesota, California, and Florida where he was entrusted with ‘righting the ship’ and instilling quality business practices; an experience that deepened his understanding of diverse markets and strengthened his adaptability. This diverse experience has given Brian a deep appreciation for the unique Colorado lifestyle. Now that he has returned to Colorado, Brian is able to use his broad perspective of different communities alongside his local knowledge and professional insight to help clients find the perfect fit for their needs, whether buying, selling, or investing.

Outside of real estate, Brian cherishes his role as a husband and father. He enjoys exploring new destinations with his family and actively supports his young daughters in their academic and extracurricular activities.

Whether you’re looking to buy your first home or expand your real estate portfolio, Brian Devlin is ready to guide you every step of the way with transparency, dedication, and a personalized approach.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
A Cornhusker through and through, this proud Nebraska native is a bit of a renaissance man. Prior to getting his real estate license in 2017, Brian worked in education, the non-profit sector and talent management. In 2016, he founded one of the country’s hottest ice cream concepts, Chaos & Cream, which was profiled on the Food Network. His meticulous attention to detail and insatiable need to please clients have helped him succeed at every stage of life and, based on the results he has already produced in real estate, clearly those skills have carried over.

Brian chose real estate because he wanted the opportunity to thoroughly and thoughtfully work with people during one of the most important periods of their life. Whether a client is purchasing a home, selling one or making an investment, it’s vital he or she has confidence in Brian and feels at ease with the process.

As for why he selected Kentwood Real Estate as his real estate home? “I want to be one of the best at everything I do, so I chose to work with the best in the business. Kentwood’s reputation is light years ahead, and each and every one of our brokers is dedicated to the highest standard of excellence and ethics.” Like any good officially recognized REALTOR®, Brian appreciates the importance of relationship building and networking. He also enjoys the role technology and social media play in today’s real estate marketing landscape.

Brian loves living in the Washington Park neighborhood with his two sons and the family dog, Barkley. On any given spring, summer or fall evening, Brian and his boys can be found at Red Rocks or Coors Field. Jakob (20) and Sam (16) are also entrepreneurs as they both own their own businesses. They have always been encouraged not only to dream, but to realize those dreams and bring them to fruition.

Brian has coached several of his boys' sports teams, supported and volunteered for a number of organizations including Boys and Girls Clubs and Jewish Family Service and served on the boards of Adoption Options and the Denver School of Science and Technology as well as PTAs at the elementary, middle and high school levels. 

In addition to live music and sporting events, Brian's interests include cooking, hiking, nutrition, skiing, traveling and yoga.

Find Brian on Facebook and Instagram: @BrianRosenKentwood.

Brian Rosen

Bridget enjoys all forms of exercise and is an avid runner. She and her family love Colorado’s natural beauty and climate. Bridget is known for her entertaining and can often be found hosting gatherings for her family and friends.
