description:
Jim Nussbaum was born and raised in Appleton, Wisconsin, receiving his Bachelor of Arts Degree (B.A.) in English from Saint John's University, Collegeville, Minnesota, with highest honors, and his Masters Degree in Business Administration/Marketing (M.B.A.) from the University of Wisconsin. He was the first person in his family to attend and graduate from college.

Jim began his sales career at the age of 17, selling vacuum cleaners door to door. He paid 100% of his way through seven years of college by selling cookware, china, flatware and cutlery for The Vita Craft Corporation, Kansas City, Missouri. Starting as a salesman, Jim was promoted to District Manager for Vita Craft. After receiving his M.B.A., Jim joined the General Electric Company (G.E.) in Corporate Planning and Market Research as a consultant, working with the company in Syracuse, New York; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Milwaukee, Wisconsin, and Chicago, Illinois. In Washington D.C. and New York City, he then joined G. E.'s educational affiliate, The General Learning Corporation, where he functioned as a Corporate Planner and a Regional Marketing Director in charge of selling educational programs to such firms as IBM.

After his employment with The General Learning Corporation, Jim joined American Salesmasters, Inc., a firm specializing in selling sales training and motivational programs throughout the country to salespeople in every sales field. He conducted hundreds of motivational sales meetings before sales groups in New York City, New York, and Colorado Springs, Colorado. While in the Springs, Jim's sales production earned him the designation of number two salesperson among 65 Salesmasters salespeople throughout the country. Jim has conducted many real estate and motivational seminars and has been on the same program with such self-help notables as the late Earl Nightingale and Dr.Norman Vincent Peale.

Jim began his residential real estate sales career as a real estate salesman with a local Denver company, Van Schaack and Co. He made the President’s Club each year, and in five of his last seven years with that firm was its top residential salesperson out of over 350 sales associates. After his eleven- year sales career with Van Schaack, Jim left the company and formed a new real estate company, The Kentwood Co., with four other Van Schaack salespeople. In 2007 the five partners sold the company to two individuals who a few years later sold the company to HomeServices of America, Inc.

Jim’s closed sales volume has been consistently high, and in several years he was recognized as the number ONE residential salesperson in the State of Colorado. In his 50+ year residential sales career, still on-going, he has participated in over 2800 closings with a closed sales volume in excess of $1.3 Billion. His real estate designations include GRI, CRS, SRES, CIPS, and CDPE. He received several real estate awards from the Denver Sales and Marketing Executives Club, as well as in-person awards from sales motivational icons the late Og Mandino and Earl Nightingale. He has been listed in Who’s Who in America.

After selling The Kentwood Company, Jim has remained with his firm in a non-ownership, sales capacity, and continues to actively sell residential real estate with his three-person team, The Kruse-Nussbaum Team. He recently wrote and published a book entitled “Significance: A Lifetime of Learning, Earning and Love”, which is available at https://www.significance-book.com/

Jim resides in Greenwood Village, Colorado, with his wife, Mary Jean. Their son, Dan, his wife, Tessa, and their daughter, Reise, live in Centennial, Colorado. Their daughter, Kate Livingston, resides in San Marcos, California, and does museum consulting and individual coaching

description:
Your Trusted Colorado Real Estate Expert – Since 1981

Real estate is more than a career for Jim Traynor — it's a lifelong passion. Licensed as a Broker and REALTOR® since 1981, Jim has helped hundreds of clients buy and sell homes throughout Colorado. With over four decades of experience, he has a deep understanding of the local market and a reputation for delivering exceptional service with honesty and integrity.

Jim’s expertise extends beyond residential sales — he has personally bought and sold numerous properties, including “fix and flips” and long-term rental investments. His firsthand experience as both a REALTOR® and property investor gives his clients a well-rounded and strategic advantage.

Jim is a Certified Residential Specialist (CRS), placing him among the top 1% of real estate professionals nationally. He is also a Seniors Real Estate Specialist (SRES), uniquely qualified to address the real estate needs of clients aged 50+.

For 27 years, Jim co-chaired the Metro List Marketing Session, a key networking forum for Denver-area agents to collaborate and share listings. His long-standing leadership in the local real estate community underscores his commitment to professional excellence.


A Personal Touch

A Denver native, Jim proudly calls Colorado home. He and his wife, Brenda, live in Denver and enjoy spending time with their growing family. Jim’s daughter, Kelsey, earned her master’s degree from the University of Denver and now works for SWCA, an employee-owned environmental firm. At just 23, she purchased her first home, carrying on the family tradition of real estate passion. Brenda’s daughter, Amy, is a respected Family Law Attorney in Denver, and her son, John, is an entrepreneur known for his innovative and actionable business ideas.

Outside of real estate, Jim is an avid skier — whether it’s heli-skiing, snowcat adventures, or downhill slopes, skiing is his adrenaline-fueled escape. Jim also proudly supports local charities, including The Third Way Center and Our Lady of Lourdes Catholic Church and School.


Why Work With Jim?

40+ years of local real estate experience
CRS and SRES designations
Proven success with home buyers, sellers, investors, and seniors
Known for responsiveness, punctuality, and integrity
Dedicated to building long-term relationships with "Customers for Life"

Whether you're buying your first home, upgrading, downsizing, or investing, Jim invites you to reach out. He’s ready to help make your next move a success.

📞 Call Jim Today: 303-888-1711

description:
More than 40 Years of Distinguished Real Estate Service

Licensed in 1982, Jinnohn has been a Kentwood agent since 1988. As a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors, she serves the diverse needs of clients throughout the Denver area and is knowledgeable in all segments of the real estate market including single family, condominiums, luxury homes, new construction and investment properties.

She is known for her superior listening skills, innovative marketing tactics and extensive market knowledge, and has garnered numerous awards for outstanding sales production.

Jinnohn's achievements are based on developing relationships. While she is passionate about utilizing the latest technology, she always falls back on her personal "tools" - attention to detail, honesty and perseverance. Even after all these years.....she still loves being a Realtor!

In her free time, Jinnohn enjoys running, reading, hiking, and traveling. She has successfully completed over 30 full marathons - you can assume she knows a little something about dedication, perseverance and toughness. She is a fourth generation native Coloradan and is fortunate to have a large, active and fun family, all of whom live nearby.

description:
With over 30 years of experience, Joe Serieno has established himself as a distinguished professional in commercial real estate, representing over 15 million square feet across more than 60 office projects. His extensive expertise encompasses agency leasing, acquisitions, and dispositions. Joe’s approach combines his vast experience with strategic planning to deliver exceptional results throughout the Denver Metro area. Specializing in the leasing of commercial office buildings, Joe partners with some of the nation’s foremost real estate owners to develop and implement tailored strategic leasing plans. These strategies are meticulously crafted to align with ownership’s investment objectives, optimize rental rates, and enhance occupancy levels, thereby significantly increasing property value.

Joe's career began with the co-founding of a successful leasing, management, and construction management company, which was later acquired by Trammell Crow. His exemplary performance earned him accolades as the #1 National Agency Broker and as a top Denver Agency Broker on multiple occasions. His success continued at CBRE, where he was recognized among the Top 10 Producers four times. In 2019, Joe joined Avison Young, where he successfully established an agency practice for the Denver Office. As a Senior Commercial Advisor at Kentwood Commercial, Joe brings his extensive experience and strategic acumen to his new role, working to enhance the value of commercial office buildings in collaboration with Kentwood Commercial’s esteemed team. He will focus on key areas including DTC/Greenwood, Inverness, Meridian, Colorado Blvd, Cherry Creek, CBD, and Golden Triangle/Capitol Hill.

Outside of his professional pursuits, Joe enjoys traveling with his family and draws inspiration from global architecture. Joe donates his time in various philanthropic endeavors, deepening his connection to the Denver community.

description:
A Denver native and a graduate of South Denver High School and the University of Northern Colorado with a B.A. in Accounting. While at UNC John was a member of the Varsity Track Team.

After a five-year stint in the Accounting field, John began his real estate career in 1972 and has consistently been amongst the top Residential Brokers in the Metro Denver area.

In 1988 John merged his real estate company, The Ansbury Company, with The Kentwood Company, and assumed the role as Broker/Managing Partner for 25 years until the sale of the company to Berkshire Hathaway. After the sale John returned to his passion of residential brokerage, while still enjoying being a personal broker to his many past clients.

Over the years John has developed a National reputation in the Corporate Relocation industry and has attended countless conferences expanding and sharing his expertise.

John has always maintained a keen interest in new luxury homes and community development and has learned that industry from the ground up.  He is frequently called on by Custom builders to consult and evaluate their projects.

A 39-year resident of Cherry Hills Village and resident of Glenmoor Contry Club, John and Sue enjoy living on the 15th tee box and enjoy participating in golf and social activites. John and Sue have two grown children and enjoy their four grandkids. "We’ve loved watching them grow and attending their games and events."

Charlie Fitzpatrick, age 20, a sophmore at the University of Alabama, is enjoying the south and college fraternity life but misses skiing in Vail.

George Fitzpatrick, age 18, an All-State lineman at Cherry Creek High where he just graduated a semester early. One of the top-rated football recruits in the nation, George was named as a 2022 High School All American, playing in the All American Bowl East/West Game in San Antonio, Texas in 2022. After recieving 38 division one football scholarship offers, George accepted an offer from Ohio State University and enrolled in January 2022. He is currently participating in The Ohio State spring Football program. 

Kaitlen Larkin, age 17, a junior at Cherry Creek High, plays on the Girls’ golf team. She fills her summers with playing golf and caddying at Cherry Hills Country Club, she is also an excellent skier and loves Steamboat Springs.

Conner Larkin, age 15, is a freshman at Cherry Creek High School. Conner is an excellent athlete and plays competitive baseball year-around and enjoys Steamboat ski slopes.

In his free time, John and Sue love getting outdoors to enjoy activities like fitness, skiing, golf, and water sports at their Cape Cod Summer Home.

description: John is a trusted and well respected Realtor who specializes in both residential and investment properties. With over a decade of experience, he has developed a keen ability to anticipate his clients’ needs and provide tailored solutions. Drawing from a strong background in project management, John’s recommendations are data-driven and informed by thorough research and analysis. His excellent communication skills, work ethic and deep local knowledge ensure that his clients receive the highest standard of service throughout their property journey.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, GRI, CNE

description:
I became a Realtor 23 years ago largely because of a great experience I had with the realtor who helped my husband and I find our first home. My Realtor was patient, and helpful and full of knowledge about the neighborhoods and places my we were considering. He did not try to impose his view of where we should live and did not pressure us to make a decision. As a result we found a home we loved, in a community that many others would have discouraged us from considering. Because of this experience, I determined that helping people find their homes would be fulfilling and fun.

I have never thought of myself as a salesperson but more as a matchmaker. Homes either are or are not right for people, If my clients get the right home for them then they are likely to be happy and use me again when they are ready to buy or sell. So, that is my job, matching people with homes that will make them as happy as my first realtor made me. Real Estate should be entertaining, It's like shopping, but the price tag is huge. I am a Denver native and my partner and I have renovated 7 homes over the past 25 years.  I have a masters in City Planning and have served on numberous city commissions and boards that work to make Denver a more livable, sustainable city,  so I can tell people about the houses they are considering and the neighborhoods that surround them. I think Denver is a great place to live.  Its many different neighborhoods, from Cherry Creek to Curtis Park, are fun to explore. I have lived throughout the city over my 50 years here, and know some places that others might not think to look. For the past 22 years, I have lived and worked mostly in the Five Points / RiNo / Curtis Park  area of Downtown and know these areas better than most any person in Denver.

If you are a buyer, I promise to work with you as long as it takes to find the house that makes you smile, without pressuring you to choose a certain neighborhood or make a decision faster. This is your home, the place you will spend your life, so it's OK if it takes a while to find the right fit.

If you are a seller, I think you should know there are three things that help match people with houses. How they show, How they are priced, and how they are advertised. These are the three variables we have to work with and I know how to work all three. When I start working with a seller, I hire a professional stager to review the property to help make sure it shows at its best. When I price a property, I go see the competition before I talk with the seller about the price of their home, and I work with Kentwood because they produce the best advertising in the city for homes. I understand that you are paying me a lot of money and I had better make sure I am worth every penny.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
As a real estate professional, I am committed to helping my clients navigate the real estate market with confidence. Whether you are buying, selling, or investing, I work tirelessly to ensure you achieve your goals and make informed decisions every step of the way. 

I am bilingual in English and Spanish that allows me to serve a diverse range of clients and communicate effectively making sure everyone feels heard and understood. Outside of real estate I enjoy fitness activities such as weightlifting and basketball. I also enjoy reading books and listening to music.

Whether you're experienced in real estate or new to real estate, I am here to make your goals a reality. Let's work together to make your dream home or investment opportunity come to life!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Jonathan has been a Colorado licensed real estate agent since 2014 and takes pride in a client first approach, providing timely and insightful communication to his clients in order to help them make informed decisions and meet their goals.

Successfully navigating a real estate transaction can be a complicated journey, and Jonathan helps make that journey easy and understandable. He recognizes the emotional and financial significance of each real estate transaction and takes immense pride in advising his clients throughout the process while providing expert due diligence and problem solving. His emphasis on market and transaction education as well as always presenting every possible option allows his clients to feel informed and confident throughout the real estate process. 

Working with an experienced and dedicated real estate professional can be the difference between selling for top dollar or securing your dream house versus leaving money on the table or missing out on your perfect home. Having helped hundreds of families, Jonathan has the experience necessary to compete in today's competitive market.

Jonathan is one of Denver’s top Real Estate agents. Among other industry accolades, Jonathan is a 6 year consecutive Five Star Professional award winner representing the top agents in the state, has been featured in multiple publications including Real Producers magazine and is consistently ranked among the top 1% of producing Real Estate agents in the Denver metro area.

Jonathan is a Denver native and attended the University of Denver where played Division 1 Golf. When not helping his clients you can find him golfing, skiing and enjoying all things Colorado outdoors. He currently lives in Sloan’s Lake with his wife, Lindsey and their black Lab, Murphy.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Deeply rooted in service, Jonathan Pierotti’s unique background has led to a successful career as a trusted and respected real estate agent. Prior to his career in real estate, Jonathan served as a patrol officer, detective, and SWAT operator for a local police department. His experiences have honed his problem-solving skills and developed his ability to work well under pressure. In addition to his law enforcement experience, Jonathan has a background in business management and project management. He has earned his Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, demonstrating his ability to manage complex projects and deliver results on time and within budget. As a Colorado native growing up in the Boulder Valley area, Jonathan holds a degree in Economics from the University of Colorado at Boulder, where he developed his analytical and critical thinking skills. This educational background has provided Jonathan with a deep understanding of the economic factors that influence the real estate market. Having such understanding allows him to identify trends and opportunities which he uses to help his clients make informed decisions about their real estate investments and avoid costly mistakes.

As a member of Peak Home Partners, Jonathan places a strong focus on teamwork, education, trust, and accountability. He understands that buying or selling a home is a significant life event and is committed to providing exceptional service to his clients. He takes the time to understand their unique needs and works tirelessly to help them achieve their real estate goals. While Jonathan is not working, he volunteers in his community, serves on a board for a veteran non-profit, and enjoys pursuing his hobbies which includes home brewing and spending time outdoors. He is also a proud sports dad of two active children and spends much of his free time attending their games and activities alongside his wife and high school sweetheart.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
JULIE AND SALLIE

Julie and Sallie are described by their clients as providing uncompromising dedication to their clients’ interests, attention to detail and the highest level of integrity. They are third generation Colorado natives who are very familiar with the neighborhoods in the Denver metropolitan area, especially the central Denver neighborhoods and the southeast suburbs including Cherry Hills and Greenwood Village.

Julie and Sallie have consistently been recognized as top ranking brokers by the Denver Metro Association of Realtors. As a team, they are formidable. They provide twice the enthusiasm, twice the creative marketing skills, twice the real estate knowledge, twice the professionalism, and twice the dedication to their clients.

Prior to joining Kentwood, Julie and Sallie were founding owners of the highly successful Fuller Towne and Country Properties and were instrumental in the company’s management, development and later sale.

They enjoy working with buyers and sellers in all price ranges from lower downtown to Castle Pines and everywhere in between.


ABOUT JULIE

Julie is a graduate of the University of Colorado in Boulder with an undergraduate degree in English.

Julie started in Residential Real Estate in 1989. She is a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors and has earned a Graduate Realtor Institute designation. 

While committed to her real estate career, Julie also enjoys many things Colorado has to offer. Being actively involved in many community opportunities Julie thinks it is important to give back to the community in which you live.

She also enjoys skiing, spending time with friends and family, tennis and volunteering at her daughter's school to support her in her education and extra-curricular activities and sports. 
 

ABOUT SALLIE

Sallie graduated from University of Colorado in Boulder with an undergraduate degree in marketing. She then attended Georgetown University Law School in Washington, DC. She has been a licensed attorney in Colorado since 1989 specializing in representing individuals and businesses in buying, selling, leasing and developing real property throughout the country.

In 1997, Sallie decided to take her real estate law expertise and her negotiation skills to the sales side of the real estate arena, where she has been highly successful and achieved exceptional results for her clients.

Sallie lives in Cherry Hills Village with her husband and three children.
title: Broker Associates, Realtors®

description:
An award-winning Realtor with 25 years of real estate experience Julie brings a unique perspective and diverse level of knowledge to the industry and, customer service.  Committed to providing exceptional customer service and delivering results that exceed her clients' expectations. Whether helping buyers find their dream home or expertly marketing and negotiating on behalf of sellers, Julie works closely with her clients to ensure their real estate goals are met with the utmost professionalism and attention to detail. 

Julie came to Colorado to attend the University of Colorado where she received a Bachelor’s Degree in Geology. She worked for 12 years as a project manager in Geochemical consulting for the environmental industry and in oil and gas exploration, and was then promoted to sales. Licensed in 2000 Julie’s Previous experiences provide a diverse range of skills which make her a great Realtor. Extremely involved in Boulder Valley School District at both the school & district levels. Like to ski, bike, cc ski, skate, kayak & camp.

"I take on the needs and desires of my clients as if they were my own and work tirelessly on their behalf to guide them through the complexities of the local real estate market."  

"As a self employed entrepreneur I am responsible for lead generation, business development and management, marketing, coordination of contracts and legal documents, scheduling of multiple vendors within contractually stipulated deadlines, accounting, publishing, maintenace of network systems and assuring complete client satisfaction."
title: Realtor®, GRI, EcoBroker

description:
Julie Hummel serves as Broker Associate for Kentwood Real Estate and is a co-founder of the Kentwood Cherry Creek office. She has been a tireless leader in the real estate industry as a business owner and licensed REALTOR® for over 40 years.

In those 40 years she has remained engaged in her community from the beginning onward as an active member of the Denver Board of Realtors®, serving as a member of the Board before ultimately serving as President in 1994. She was appointed NAR Federal Political Coordinator to Congresswoman Diana DeGette in 1997 and has been reappointed every two years since then. 

She has always been an RPAC investor and actively recruits other Realtors® to invest. Julie has always taken the industry seriously and been a successful small business owner. She co-founded Preferred Properties, Moore Preferred Properties and Kentwood Cherry Creek in 1998. All are success stories, and she helped and mentored many brokers to become successful while giving her clients first class service all the way.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
In a former life, Julie trained in Music Business and Sound Engineering at The University of Colorado, and Acting at the Beverly Hills Playhouse. She spent a couple of years behind the scenes at the Denver Center Theater as a sound engineer, and many years in front of the scenery in Hollywood, acting, before tackling the intriguing world of Real Estate Sales!

Now In her 25th successful year in Real Estate Sales and Consulting, Julie is a third generation Colorado Native with deep roots first planted in the state by her great-grandfather, Winter Fyfe, who came over from Scotland and ran the general store at the Tomboy Mine in Telluride. Julie’s grandfather was in the early mortgage business in Denver, and her Mom was one of Denver’s first iconic female Realtors. So, a deep love and knowledge of Denver Real Estate is in Julie’s blood. She is passionate about sharing her broad knowledge of Denver’s neighborhoods, history, and dynamic Real Estate market with her clients, Buyers and Sellers, first time and experienced. One of her favorite things to do is to give new Denver buyers a grand tour of the city to start the process of selecting the right neighborhood for their needs.

Julie is well known for her integrity, honesty, and negotiating skills in guiding clients through transactions, both home sales and purchases, and especially her ability to make the process pleasant for her clients. She has garnered many accolades including the Five Star Realtor® Award 2010 -2025; 5280 Top Producer 2020-2025,The Kentwood Real Estate 10 Million Dollar Club 2011-2025, the Denver Metro Association of Realtors® Million Dollar Round Table 2003-2025, Top 10 Individual Production Kentwood Cherry Creek 2018-2024, Real Trends top 250 Colorado Broker 2021 and Top 1.5% National Broker 2023 and 2025.

Julie is a longtime volunteer for and supporter of children’s, animal, and environmental causes, including the Denver School of the Arts, Invest in Kids, Friends of Manual High School, Greenpeace, Environmental Defense Fund, K9 Global Rescue ASPCA, Historic Denver, and is a Colorado Public Radio Evergreen member. She loves the mountains and the ocean, skiing, cycling, singing, yoga, and acting when she can squeeze it in! Most of all, she loves her amazing grown son, Billy and her two dogs, Roy and Georgie-boy!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Born and raised in Wyoming, Justin learned the foundation for hard work at a young age.  After moving to Colorado in 2001 he pursued a Business Management Degree and followed in his father’s footsteps in owning his own Construction company.

After successfully operating his business for 14 years Justin decided to follow his passion of Real Estate.  He believes that Real Estate is more than buying and selling houses.  It is creating relationships.  It is helping others create wealth.  It is being able to advise clients as well as friends and family as to the best options for their individual situations.  It is about building a stronger community.

Justin has three school aged children and believes that family is always first.  He enjoys watching them excel in school as well as the sports that they enjoy.  In his free time, he enjoys any sporting activity, especially golf.  He is an avid Fly fisherman, that enjoys the outdoors and hiking in the Colorado Foothills.  He loves to cook as well as dine at the multitude of great dining options that Northern Colorado has to offer.  You might also run into him at one of the many local breweries.

Justin’s knowledge of Construction can be a valuable asset to you whether you are buying a residential property, or an investment property.  Justin believes that his passion for Real Estate along with his vast knowledge of business can deliver an incredible experience in your Real Estate transaction.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Karen Landers has marketed, sold and leased properties throughout the Denver Metro Area including LoDo, Uptown, the Golden Triangle, the Ballpark Neighborhood and the burgeoning RiNo District since 2000. Her in-depth knowledge of the entire Denver Metro area not only comes from her years of experience in the field, but it is also the place she calls home. Her background includes financial analysis reporting, market research and development. Karen’s intimate understanding of small business concerns make her the perfect agent to partner with in developing new entities or relocating established groups. With over two decades of experience as a commercial broker, Karen specializes in both representing sellers and landlords, as well as occupier services for both owner/users and investors in the multi-family, industrial, office and retail sectors. She continues to be one of the most knowledgeable and sought-after experts in the field and her versatile background makes her an exceptional choice for real estate clients.

 She graduated with a bachelor’s degree in political science with a minor in English from New York University. She lives in Cherry Creek with her family and beloved dog; Karen enjoys spending time in the mountains skiing, hiking, playing tennis, and is passionately involved in the Denver art community.
title: Managing Broker of Kentwood Commercial, Senior Commercial Advisor

description:
EXPERIENCE

Karen’s breadth of real estate expertise is an accumulation of experience representing sellers and buyers in the Denver area for over twenty-five years. Born and raised in Denver, Karen has an intimate knowledge of Denver proper as well as the multitude of outlying communities, as she has been a part of Denver’s evolution from a small and quaint city to the growing metropolis that it has become today. Karen has represented sellers and buyers in all market conditions from booms to busts and Karen’s ongoing success is a direct result of her knowledge of and passion for real estate in the greater Denver area, her complete dedication to her clients, and her pursuit of cultivating authentic relationships with her clients, her peers, and her community.

Karen and her Broker Associates are backed by the elite team at Kentwood Real Estate, a solidly established company that has been providing top-level real estate services to their brokers and their brokers’ clients for over forty years and is widely regarded as one of the premier real estate firms in the Denver area.

BUYERS                                                       

Karen has a great talent in turning her client’s “wish list” into a focused home search by actively listening to their wants and needs and helping them to prioritize the logistical, social, and emotional criteria that are most important to their lifestyle and home search goals. No matter the price point, Karen works tirelessly to find her clients the home of their dreams while making sure that they are well-informed, well-represented, and well-positioned during every step of the journey from showings to the closing and beyond. Throughout her career Karen has established a vast network of professionals on which she can readily call for client services and specialty advice such as inspectors, surveyors, designers, contractors, builders, mortgage brokers, title companies and attorneys- this is an invaluable resource for Karen’s buyers. Additionally, Karen’s long-time relationships with her broker peers is also a tremendous value to her buyer clients as Karen will often seek out pre-market properties in the desired communities. Rest assured in knowing that the names Karen Brinckerhoff and Kentwood Real Estate as broker on a purchase offer reflect a high level of validity and professionalism which is incredibly beneficial to buyers especially during this competitive season in Denver real estate.

SELLERS

From cottages to grand estates, Karen represents sellers at every price level. She parlays her extensive community knowledge and years of listing experience into creating and executing a unique and comprehensive marketing strategy for each property. Karen’s discerning eye for interior design is invaluable as she works with her sellers alongside a network of designers, contractors, and staging companies to ensure the home is presented to maximize and display its highest potential. Utilizing a combination of print, digital, and social media coupled with personal word-of-mouth advertising Karen’s properties are well-exposed and beautifully showcased to the target buyer. Karen also has a refined ability to evaluate current competitive market pricing against her listings to ensure that her clients’ properties are priced effectively to capture every dollar of value. From pre-marketing efforts to post-sale support, Karen and her team provide an exceptional level of communication to the client. Additionally, should the property be vacant or the seller out of town, Karen will oversee any listing/transaction activity at the property in the seller’s absence bringing great peace of mind to Karen’s clients. Karen, her team, and Kentwood Real Estate pride themselves on providing a five-star comprehensive listing experience to their sellers.

RELOCATION SERVICES

As a Certified Relocation Specialist and a member of Leading Real Estate Companies of the World, Karen is a wonderful resource whether you are relocating to the Denver area or moving to another city or state. Her deep knowledge of Denver and the surrounding communities enables Karen to educate incoming buyers as to the multitude of different neighborhoods, schools, social attractions, and other activities that the area has to offer before defining the areas in which to search. After representing her relocation buyers in their home purchase, Karen’s large sphere of local vendors, contractors, and professional services allows Karen to help her clients get established quickly and confidently into their new home as well as into the Denver area lifestyle. For clients who are relocating away from the Denver area, Karen has a broad network of global real estate advisors on which she can rely to efficiently assist her clients as they move to their new city or state.

AWARDS & ACCOLADES

2022 - 5280 Magazine Five Star Real Estate Professional – Double Black Diamond Broker Designation
2021 - Denver Metro Association of Realtors – Black Diamond Award - $40+ million in sales volume
2012 – 2021 – 5280 Magazine Five Star Real Estate Professional Designation
2021- Kentwood Real Estate – Top Five Broker
2020 – Denver Metro Association of Realtors – Titanium Award $30-$39 million sales volume
2019, 2020 - Kentwood Real Estate – Top Ten Broker
Kentwood Real Estate – Ongoing Annual Member of the Top Producers Club $10+ million sales volume
Denver Board of Realtors Roundtable – Recognized annually as a top volume producing Broker
Coldwell Banker (previous firm) – President’s Circle and President’s Elite Designations
Certified Relocation Specialist
Certified Denver Landmark Real Estate Professional
Member - The Denver Board of Realtors and The National Association of Realtors
Member – Leading Real Estate Companies of the World
Bachelor of Science Degree – CSU Fort Collins
REFERRALS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Originally from Taiwan and fluent in Mandarin Chinese, Karl's family moved to Fort Collins Colorado in 1983 when he was eight, He worked at FirstBank of Northern Colorado throughout college and after graduating from Colorado State University in 1998, Karl took a position at State Farm Insurance as an underwriter. In 2001, he began his real estate career with John Laing Homes as an on-site salesperson selling in several communities including the highly desirable Central Park development in Denver. 


As one of Central Park’s first residents, he's met and worked with hundreds of homeowners/friends  in the community. He's become such a neighborhood fixture and still continues to live in the community that he loves and help build. Throughout his career, he has helped Buyers and Sellers all over Colorado including as far North as Fort Collins and as far South as Colorado Springs with everywhere else in between. 

A savvy real estate veteran with over 22 years experience and knowledge, Karl offers an inside track to Buyers who are seeking the right home for their lifestyles and a creative and fresh approach to getting your homes sold.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Combining her background in mountain and luxury property with her passion for city living, Kat's holistic approach to Real Estate is modern, authentic, and contagiously positive. 

Hailing from the heart of Denver itself, Kat is a true native with a relentless drive and has been described by her clients as creative, compassionate, and loyal. Her infectious positivity is balanced by her innate competitive spirit, and she's known for her prowess in negotiation, consistently propelling her clients to the forefront of their real estate goals. From Fort Collins to Colorado Springs and everywhere in between, Kat doesn't merely facilitate real estate transactions; she becomes your trusted advisor, guiding you through every facet of homeownership to not only bolster your financial portfolio but also safeguard your investments and ensure you're well-versed in the process of buying and selling real estate.

With her deep-rooted knowledge of the Denver area, Kat will become your area expert. Her wealth of experience extends beyond the typical boundaries of real estate, encompassing an intimate understanding of the city's diverse neighborhoods, vibrant culture, and ever-evolving real estate market. Kat's passion for city living is grounded in her firsthand knowledge of Denver's unique charm and her deep connection to the area allows her to tailor her services to your specific needs, whether you're seeking a cozy urban nest or a suburban haven.

When you choose Kat as your trusted partner in real estate, you're not just gaining a Realtor, you're gaining a seasoned professional who combines her expertise with her love for the state she calls home. Her dedication to her clients goes beyond the transaction, ensuring that you're not just buying or selling a property, but also investing in a brighter future. Kat's commitment to building wealth, protecting investments, and educating her clients about the nuances of the real estate process sets her apart as the ideal choice for anyone seeking a holistic, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate Realtor in Denver.

Outside of Real Estate, Kat can be found giving her rescue mutts, Frank and Steve, endless hugs & kisses. All her life Kat has volunteered at a plethora of animal rescues and shelters and even fostered dogs until they found their forever home (although she admittingly wound up adopting most of them herself). If you are considering adopting a rescue pet, Kat recommends the Douglas County Canine Rescue, which you can find more information about here:  https://douglascountycanine.org/


Professional Achievements

- Denver Real Producers Magazine - Denver's Rising Star 2023

- 5280 Magazine Top Real Estate Producer - No. 1 Producing Team, Kentwood Real Estate, 2021

- 5280 Magazine Top Real Estate Producer - Top Producing Team, Kentwood Real Estate, 2022

- Board of Directors, Kentwood Cares Foundation
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
With an eye for timeless design and a deep understanding of investment value, Katherine brings a refined perspective to Denver’s luxury real estate market. Originally from the North Shore of Chicago, her early appreciation for classic architecture—graceful wainscoting, elegant crown moldings, and rich natural stone—was shaped by years spent living in two of the country’s most architecturally significant cities: Chicago and New York.

Katherine’s academic background includes a Bachelors of Science from Lehigh University and a Masters from Columbia University, experiences that reinforced her meticulous attention to detail and unmatched work-ethic. After a successful decade in the commercial solar industry—where she negotiated multi-million dollar deals with the nation’s largest commercial real estate firms—Katherine transitioned into residential real estate, bringing with her a high-level negotiating acumen and a passion for helping clients make discerning property decisions.

Since relocating to Denver in 2017 with her Boulder-native husband, Katherine has become a sought-after advisor for buyers and sellers across the Front Range and beyond. Her experience spans luxury renovations that double property values, high-return investment homes, and bespoke new construction projects in premier markets including Denver, Boulder, and Vail Valley.

Real estate is a family legacy for Katherine. With immediate family in mortgage lending, real estate sales, and property investment, her commitment to excellence runs deep. Whether you're searching for a legacy property, a sophisticated pied-à-terre, or your dream mountain retreat, Katherine offers a white-glove experience rooted in discretion, integrity, and results.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
It has always been my mission to provide unparalleled client experiences and create strong partnerships with my clients based on trust, expertise, honesty, and impeccable service. Buying and listing campaigns are truly unique to each person and require in-depth insights into the current market conditions, strong real estate knowledge, mindful preparation, insightful counsel, and genuine, caring listening skills. I want my clients to feel that I have their back by providing effective, results-oriented negotiation skills, and I want them to also feel they can unquestionably rely on me to help them fully navigate the sales process to achieve their goals, not mine.

I am an extremely proud member of the Kentwood family, and the professional and ethical standards that have made it such a highly respected, trusted brand and integral part of the Denver community. It has been my humble honor to receive the 2025 Denver Board of Realtors Silver Excellence Award for the third year in a row, and the 2025 Five Star Real Estate Professional Award, making it the sixth consecutive year to receive that wonderful recognition. It has equally been very rewarding to serve as a Board Member and Fundraising Committee Co-Chair for the Kentwood Cares Foundation.

As a Realtor for over 20 years, I have been a Member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors, the South Metro Board of Realtors, the National Association of Realtors, and I hold the Graduate Realtor Institute Designation held by only 15% of realtors nationwide. I was raised in the San Diego area and relocated to this most beautiful state of Colorado 45 years ago, where I graduated with distinction from Colorado State University. I was honored to be a member of and captain the first Title IX Women’s Volleyball Team to its first-ever postseason national championship appearance. Junior Olympic Volleyball development was a very important part of my early professional life, and not only was I fortunate enough to coach at CSU, but I was also a Co-Founder and first Vice President of the Junior Olympic Division within USA Volleyball. Aside from my passion for real estate, some of my most favorite things now are playing golf, spending time with my family and friends, reading, gardening, hiking, walking my dog, and going to concerts. The beach is a long way away in both time and distance, but it’s still one of my most favorite places to spend the day!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, GRI

description: Raised in Aspen, Colorado, Katie has called Denver home for over a decade. When assisting her clients buy and sell real estate, Katie creates an environment where her clients feel wholeheartedly supported while simultaneously achieving their real estate dreams. Her acumen, attention to detail, and willingness to support her clients through each and every step of the process make her a wonderful choice for Denver home buyers and sellers in search of a realtor. In her own words, “I have always really appreciated architecture, design and the process of making a house a home. As much as I have enjoyed my experience in every career I have had, my progression into real estate has been a dream come true."
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description: Since entering the real estate profession in 1977, Keith Combs has sold more than 1000 homes and earned a law degree. And while he was doing that, he was named "Father of the Year" by his four children. A Denver native, Keith received a business degree from Florida State University and a Law Degree from the University of Denver. As a former chairperson of the Park Hill Children's Center preschool board of directors and as past President of the Graland Country Day School Parent Association, he believes in giving something back to the community. In his leisure time, he enjoys soccer, swimming, horseback riding, field hockey, lacrosse, baseball, hockey, and golf--the sports which his kids play. After 27 years of teaching English at Cherry Creek High School, his wife Becky is the marketing director of a financial planning firm.. When asked to describe Keith, his clients will invariably say "he listens and he cares."
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Kelly and Greg bring a highly successful team approach to Kentwood Real Estate. For over 20 years they have helped Buyers and Sellers close over 500 million dollars in Real Estate transactions and have consistently received recognition from the Denver Board of Realtor's Roundtable of Excellence for their sales achievement. Both bring an outstanding commitment to customer service; beginning with listening to and understanding their client's needs, complimented by hard work and tenacity throughout the sales process.

They are Certified Relocation Specialists, Certified Negotiation Experts, Certified Military Residential Specialists, Members of the National Association of Realtors, Colorado Association of Realtors, Who's Who in Luxury Real Estate and Luxury Portfolio International Real Estate as well as the Denver Board of Realtors. From 2012 through 2024, this high producing team was presented with the Top Real Estate Producers Award for 2020 and also has received Denver's Five Star Legend’s award, based on customer satisfaction, and are continuously featured in 5280 Magazine. Kelly and Greg specialize in both the resale market as well as new construction, through their extensive knowledge and close working relationships with Denver's local and national home builders.

Their association with the Leading Real Estate Companies of The World enables them to assist you, your friends and family members when moving to any city across the country.

They assist their clients far beyond the sale and purchase of homes by providing continued knowledge and support through their extensive network of service providers. Prior to their real estate careers, Kelly and Greg have each had over 20 years of corporate sales and marketing experience, negotiating contracts with numerous corporations throughout the United States. These expert negotiating skills will become invaluable to you in your home sale transaction.

Greg has lived in Denver over 40 years and brings solid experience and expertise in the downtown LODO, Washington Park and Cherry Creek real estate markets in addition to DTC, Preserve, Greenwood Village, and Southern Denver markets.

Kelly has lived in Denver over 35 years and resides in the DTC area after residing in the Wildcat Ridge/Highlands Ranch area for 11 yeas and compliments her expertise of the Ranch, Lone Tree, and Littleton areas with her knowledge if the southern suburbs including, Castle Pines, Castle Rock, and Parker.

Whether you are buying, selling, or looking for a resort or investment property, Kelly and Greg will go above and beyond your expectations to help you find the home that is right for you. When you are hiring a Real Estate professional, experience matters. Don't settle for less, call them today for all of your real estate needs.

Kelly: 303.359.6836 Greg: 303.726.9471
title: Broker Associates

description:
Passion | Ownership | Expertise

Since purchasing my first home at 25 years old I have been passionate about the incredible investment opportunity that comes with owning real estate. I believe that anyone and everyone should be able to own their own home. The sense of pride that accompanies possessing something truly yours—something you can pass down to future generations or leverage for personal income—is unparalleled. I love being able to support my clients with one of the largest decisions in their lives and look forward to being a dedicated agent every step of the real estate process.

title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Did you know there are over 1.5 million real estate agents in the United States? Very few make it their full-time career—and even fewer truly excel. If you're looking for a skilled, relationship-driven professional with deep local knowledge, proven results, and experience through multiple market cycles, meet Keri Duffy. She's been in real estate since the early 2000s and has watched Denver evolve into the dynamic city it is today.

Based in Denver, Keri serves the greater metro area as a full-time, full-service Realtor® who helps people navigate real estate with clarity and confidence. She's worked with first-time buyers, clients struggling to downsize, and families navigating major life transitions—like helping sell the family home or managing an investment property sale from another state. Her client base is diverse: from truck drivers to tech professionals, nonprofit workers, medical professionals, and engineers. Whether it's couples just starting out, families seeking schools and community, or independent women looking for safety and security—whether you're buying your first place, selling a longtime home, or supporting a loved one through a move, Keri believes everyone deserves thoughtful guidance and strong representation.

Empathetic and grounded, she understands that life happens—and not every home is pristine. She's helped clients buy and sell hoarding properties, fixers, and investments. She's also worked with clients who value privacy and discretion. She's met movers, coordinated painters and cleaners, and handled on-site logistics for out-of-state sellers navigating difficult situations. Her approach is defined by consistency, resourcefulness, and trust—and it's shaped by your goals and your timeline. Whether it takes a few months or a few years, she stays in your corner.

Keri's clients often describe her as a mix of "protective sister" and "go-getter"—someone who's both candid and direct. She's known for her fierce loyalty and for negotiating like it matters—because it does. One cooperating broker even called her "a bulldog at the closing table" in front of her client (who smiled and nodded). She takes that as a compliment.

Keri also believes that every property has a story—and every listing deserves marketing that honors it. Selling in the 2025 market requires more than just uploading professional photos to the MLS. It takes creativity, market insight, and a network of trusted professionals—from roofing specialists to design-minded stagers. Her strategic, cross-platform marketing is designed to position each listing thoughtfully for the right audience, with the goal of netting her clients the most proceeds, on a timeline that works for you—minimizing risk to limit stress.

Purchasing in 2025 requires more than an MLS auto-search and opening doors. Recent surveys show that 36% of buyers cite budget constraints as a barrier to purchase. First, she connects buyers with the right lenders—from credit specialists to jumbo or ARM products—and whether you have a W-2 or K-1, she has the right lender for you. Insurance is the latest challenge to the market, and she has great contacts there too. Thanks to her extensive agent network, Keri often learns about off-market and pre-MLS opportunities before the public. Can't find what you're looking for? Even with greater inventory, a recent 2025 survey found that 44% of buyers still can't find a property that meets their needs. She'll make the calls, write the letters, and tap into relationships built over decades. She's built a strong reputation not just with clients—but with fellow Realtors®, who often turn to her for advice and collaboration. That credibility matters—and translates to real access.

Her passion lies in helping people build long-term financial security through real estate—whether it's a first home, a forever home, or a lock-and-leave lifestyle. Having moved 15 times across eight states as a child, she brings real empathy to every transition. She's also a trusted resource for clients relocating to Colorado, offering personalized insights on neighborhoods, schools, and lifestyle fit throughout the Denver metro area.

Keri's real estate journey began behind the scenes—as a broker assistant. Under the mentorship of Kentwood CEO Gretchen Rosenberg and other luxury brokers, she earned what she calls a "paid Master's degree" in real estate. That foundation, combined with years of front-line experience, gives her a deep understanding of both the business and emotional sides of every transaction.

Keri holds multiple professional designations, including Certified Negotiation Expert (CNE) and Senior Real Estate Specialist (SRES). She's served as a Director on the Board of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors® and remains active on the Market Trends, Government Affairs, and DMAR Gives Foundation Committees. She's been interviewed by 9News, 5280, and other publications and is a member of Kentwood's $10M Club, a DMAR Excellence Award winner, and a Five Star Professional honoree.

Outside of real estate, you'll find her exploring Denver's dining scene or catching a show at Red Rocks. A former social butterfly turned homebody, she now enjoys Bravo or reading at home and going down interior design trends online. A self-proclaimed "aspiring golfer and skier," Keri says her logo—the North Star—is more than just a design; it reflects her belief in guiding people toward what matters most: home, stability, and long-term financial security.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Originally from Chicago, Kim earned her B.S. in marketing from Indiana University with a concentration in French from the University of Strasbourg. She started her professional career in the pharmaceutical industry, and was fortunate to have lived in many exciting cities including Miami, Boston, Paris, France, and Bologna, Italy. She landed in Denver in 1999 and knew this was the place to plant roots.  Kim is extremely proud to call the Mile High City her home. 

Since earning her Realtor® license in 2004 , Kim has assisted clients with nearly $220 million in closed sales. Renowned developers, East West Partners and The Nichols Partnership hired her to launch and market their luxury projects in downtown Denver which included several phases of Riverfront Park and the launch of Spire. In 2009 she made the decision to join Kentwood Real Estate, Denver’s premier full-service real estate firm, to expand her passion for assisting buyers and sellers with their real estate needs throughout the Denver metro area.

Kim’s 35 years of sales and marketing experience taught her creative ways of marketing properties as well as valuable techniques to negotiate and handle all aspects of your real estate transactions. She demonstrates a thorough understanding of the local market, and is known for her professionalism, integrity, and strong work ethic.  She has earned a reputation for providing exceptional client service through outstanding communication skills and attention to detail. She is honored that most of her business has come from referrals and repeat business. Kim goes the extra mile to ensure that she has met and exceeded each client’s individual needs and expectations.

You may have seen Kim when she was profiled in the Denver Post business section and in Smart Money magazine for her experience in buying investment property within an IRA retirement account. This is a unique opportunity for investors to grow their retirement dollars and Kim is happy to share her knowledge of this process.

Year after year, she has been named one of Kentwood’s top producing agents and is a multi-year winner (2011-2024) of 5280 Magazine’s FIVE STAR PROFESSIONAL award as well as the Denver Board of Realtors (DMAR) Excellence Award year after year for providing the highest level of overall client satisfaction. 

Kim believes in giving back to the community through her support of numerous charitable organizations, a few of which include Smile Train, Guiding Eyes for the Blind, The Nature Conservancy, Forgotten Felines Rescue and The Denver Rescue Mission. In her free time, she and her husband love to hike, bike and snowshoe. While Denver is home, travel is her passion and she is always researching new and exotic places to explore. 

Kim would be honored to have the opportunity to earn your trust with your next real estate transaction.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
With over 20 years of diverse real estate experience, Kris Laine brings passion, drive and determination to the Northern Colorado real estate market. In 1988, Kris began her career in Commercial Real Estate in Los Angeles, California. Quickly discovering her passion for the business, she expanded her knowledge and expertise to include Leasing, Sales, Management and Investment achieving many Local, National and International awards throughout her career in Los Angeles. 

In 2006, Kris and her family relocated to Fort Collins, Colorado, where she focused her energy on family and juggling her 3 very busy children. In 2014, after thoroughly exploring all her options, she made the decision to re-enter the real estate profession. Since coming back, Kris has embraced helping Buyers and Sellers in all aspects of Real Estate. Her extensive and broad knowledge base, along with her passion, drive and determination has brought much success achieving Top National sales rankings for 3 consecutive years.   

Kris has been married for 28 years to her husband Steve. Her children Matthew, Katherine and Olivia have acclimated well to the Northern Colorado. Kris is an avid cyclist and fitness enthusiast. Her commitment stretches throughout the Fort Collins community. She and her husband actively support several organizations including: Junior Achievement, CMEC (Colorado Moves to End Cancer), Boys & Girls Club of Larimer County, Rotary Club of Fort Collins and The Better Business Bureau.
title: Broker Associate, RPA, CNE

description:
Rooted in faith, driven by purpose, I will hold your real estate dreams with precision and care. 

 Hi, I’m Kristin. Stylist turned Real Estate Agent!

You might be thinking, why on earth would I work with a former hair stylist to help me on my real estate journey. Funny enough, it was the ultimate preparation for real estate–each client was trusting me with their physical experience while simultaneously sharing the personal details of their lives. I mastered multi-tasking, active listening, and taking the utmost care for my clients.

Still, I never thought I would be where I am today, but I trusted God’s plans and now it has become much more than a job. It is my purpose. 

In 2008, I bought my first home and without knowing what I was doing, proceeded to buy, sell, and flip 8 homes. I quickly saw the opportunity in the real estate market and became fascinated with how it could empower me. I negotiated two off-market properties, all without a license or formal education, and have now managed two rental properties.

Although it was clear that real estate was something I enjoyed, developing it into a career was not in my plans. In early 2021, I was faced with a moment in time when everything changed. I needed to provide for my family and I asked God to show me the path of least resistance. 

That path was to serve others as a guide on their own real estate journeys. Real estate is much more than buying or selling a property. It is a deeply personal experience that must be handled with precision and care. 

It is with that mindset that I got my license in less than 3 months and had my very first closing for a client weeks later. This turned into a thriving business and I've been named one of the top 300 agents in Northern Colorado for two consecutive years.

The milestones and accolades are important, but helping families turn their real estate dreams into reality is my passion.  Your wealth, your journey, and your desires are like my own–I handle them with clarity and care.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Kyle Malnati is a distinguished figure in the real estate community, specializing in working with both Sellers and Buyers with their multifamily and residential needs. With a wealth of experience and a deep understanding of the intricacies of the Denver metro real estate market, Kyle brings a unique blend of expertise, market insight, and negotiation skills to every transaction. His client-centric approach and dedication to delivering exceptional results and maximizing investments is unmatched. Prior to joining Kentwood Real Estate, Kyle was the founder and CEO of the award-winning Calibrate Real Estate company since 2016. Under Kyle’s leadership, Calibrate was recognized by the Denver Business Journal as a Top 20 Commercial Brokerage Firm from 2020-2022.

With a remarkable track record and a commitment to excellence, Kyle has garnered numerous accolades and recognition, both locally and nationally, throughout his career. One of his notable achievements came in 2017 when he was honored with the prestigious “40 Under 40” Award by the Denver Business Journal, a testament to his outstanding contributions to the real estate sector. Earlier in his career, in 2012, he was also named among the “30 Under 30” by Realtor Magazine, showcasing his exceptional talent and dedication. Furthermore, Kyle is frequently acknowledged as a Heavy Hitter by the Denver Metro Commercial Association of Realtors (DMCAR), highlighting his expertise and influence within the Denver metropolitan area’s real estate market.

Beyond his professional accomplishments, Kyle is an enthusiast of personal development and actively engages with Dave Ramsey’s EntreLeadership program, demonstrating his continuous pursuit of knowledge and leadership skills. He enjoys spending time with his wife Courtney, and their three teenagers: Charlotte, Henry and Amelia at their lake house in Grand Lake when they aren’t driving a carpool to club sports. Kyle is also an avid reader, actively participates in his church community, and recharges his dynamic lifestyle with visits to Chipotle.
title: Commercial Broker, Residential Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Meet Larry Hotz, a Denver Relocation Expert with Kentwood Real Estate. He's a real estate veteran with over 35 years as a Denver Realtor selling luxury homes in the city and throughout the Denver suburbs. He's been recognized every year as a top selling real estate Broker.

He leads The Hotz Group. Together with his daughters Elizabeth and Meredith, they sell at all price points throughout the Denver metro area. They have been involved in charity and philanthropic projects in their home town of Cherry Hills Village and throughout the Denver metro area.

"I have appreciated my clients over the years", Larry explains. "I give each one my total dedication to achieving their goals. As a result, many have honored me with their repeat business buying and selling homes. Now, my daughters are working with their sons and daughters for their real estate needs. It's been a great experience."

He is a Certified Residential Specialist which is the highest designation offered by an affiliate of the National Association of Realtors. That means his sales and education is in the top 3% of all Realtors nationwide.

Larry has been a top selling real estate broker in Denver and the Denver suburbs continuously since 1978. His depth of experience includes managing a major real estate firm for nine years. He also has taught continuing education part-time as a Senior Faculty Member for the Colorado Association of Realtors and the Colorado Real estate Commission while continuing to help his clients buy and sell homes.

Denver Relocation
Larry specializes in helping Denver relocation buyers move here. He is well versed in both the city and Denver suburbs. He is great at finding neighborhoods, schools and lifestyles geared to how you and your family live. 

He has also helped Denver and national companies such as Xerox, Pepsi Cola, The University of Colorado Health Sciences Center and Pfizer relocate their key personnel. If you or company assigns yo to a national relocation company, rest assured, Larry is approved to be your Realtor. All you have to do is ask for him and Kentwood Real Estate by name.

Cherry Hills Village Suburb
He is a former Director of the Denver Board of Realtors, Colorado Association of Realtors and A and former President of the Cherry Hills Heights Water and Sanitation Board. He has lived in Cherry Hills Colorado for over 20 years with his family. He has sold many luxury homes in Cherry Hills and throughout the south Denver metro area.

Larry works personally with all buyers and sellers. You won't be shuffled off to an 'assistant'! Over 65% of Larry's business comes from former, satisfied clients. As an accredited relocation broker, Larry has sold homes in most areas of Denver and its suburbs. Because he not a 'neighborhood specialist' for just one neighborhood, he knows the advantages and disadvantages of all neighborhoods.

"My clients and I enjoy long term relationships", Larry says. "I have helped some of them relocate several times and even helped three generations in some families with their real estate needs. They aren't afraid to call me to ask questions long after a sale is completed. I enjoy helping people settle in and often introduce them to neighbors who are also my clients. They know I care about them and want to help.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
LAURA FULLER  |  ASSOCIATE BROKER  |  KENTWOOD CITY PROPERTIES

A self-declared “foodie,” when Laura is asked what restaurants she wants to try, she whips out her phone, and checks off the list she keeps meticulously. Not surprisingly, she credits her tireless attention to detail and focus on organization as keys to keeping her clients delighted, turning them into relationships for life. Of course, her Midwest work ethic and determination to succeed help too. “I never leave a stone unturned” beams Fuller.

Laura is quick to credit her incredible team for many of her achievements. She is a 5280 Magazine 5 Star agent, a 2019 Rising Star and has averaged $6M in sales over the last three years. “My team has led Kentwood City Properties’ office for two years because we focus on making each other better and ignore traditional hierarchies.”

After earning her degree in advertising from Michigan State, Laura followed the advice of mentors, ultimately getting her license while living in Chicago. “I recognized that real estate gave me the opportunity to set goals as big as I was willing to work hard.”

Beginning Laura’s story talking about work might give the wrong impression. The pride she feels being a wife and mother exceeds anything she could ever accomplish with a business card. It is that balance which attracted her to the profession and the raving recommendation of three friends at Kentwood that brought her to Denver’s premiere brokerage.

“I’m a big believer in Karma. Focusing as much on my family and community as much as my career, and always trying to pay things forward is a lesson I am teaching my daughters. It’s never too early in life to give your time, treasure and talents to those less fortunate.” 

Laura volunteers at her two daughters’ schools, The Denver Hospice Inpatient Care Center at Lowry, the Denver Mission and Dumb Friends League.

Laura points to Ellen DeGeneres as a present-day hero. “The woman is relentlessly positive, kind, generous and brave.”

Laura loves spending leisure time with her dog, skiing, golf and travel. She has explored 5 of the world’s 7 continents.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Leslie Monaco, a born and raised Denver native, has been involved in the real estate industry since 2001 and has helped hundreds of clients call Denver their home.  Real estate is her passion and that passion reflects on her sincerity in helping clients achieve their real estate goals and needs.  Clients that work with Leslie are provided with first class service from the start, throughout their real estate process and beyond the closing.  This is evidenced by her being recognized as a 5280 Five Star Real Estate Agent based on customer satisfaction for the past four years.  Leslie is a part of a top producing team with The Kentwood Company who consistently sell over $20,000,000 in Metro Denver real estate each year.

She primarily focuses on residential sales on the west side of Metro Denver including Lakewood, Wheat Ridge, Arvada and Littleton. Leslie resides in Lakewood with her husband and daughters.

What Clients are Saying About Her Services:

“We are so happy with our choice to have Leslie Monaco help us sell our home.  Leslie is very professional and took the time to sit down with us and explain all the details of her services before we even made the decision to work with her.  She listened to what we were looking to accomplish, and she gave her advice based on what was best suited for us.

Leslie is also very determined, she was very proactive in handling all of the offers we received and walked us through which options worked best for us.  She was always available, and even made the effort to help us lock in an offer on a holiday weekend.

Leslie gave us very helpful information on what to renovate or modify with our house to make it more appealing and easier to sell.  The process of selling our house went very smoothly.  If a problem arose, Leslie was on top of it and handled it promptly and professionally.  Her advice turned out to be very good, and we ended up selling our house for more than we actually set out to get.

We would recommend Leslie Monaco to any of our friends and family who want to sell their house and we know she would work hard to help them accomplish that goal.”

 Mike and Holly

For more testimonials go to: www.LeslieMonaco.com/Testimonials

Awards & Affiliations

Leslie had been recognized as a 5280 Five Star Professional Real Estate Agent based on customer service for the past four years. Along with her partner Doug Hutchins, they have sold over $20,000,000 in Metro Denver Real Estate each year since joining The Kentwood Company. She is a member of the National Association of REALTORS®, the Colorado Association of REALTORS® and the Denver Metro Association of REALTORS®.  She has earned the ABR (Accredited Buyer Representative) which is a coveted designation awarded by the Real Estate Buyer’s Agent Council (REBAC), an affiliate of the National Association of REALTORS®, to real estate practitioners who meet the specified educational and practical experience criteria. In 2014, she earned the GRI (Graduate REALTOR® Institution). A GRI designation is the mark of a real estate professional who has made the commitment to provide a high level of professional services by securing a strong educational foundation. GRIs are recognized nationally and have developed a solid foundation of knowledge and skills to navigate the current real estate climate—no matter what its condition.

In 2015, she obtained her Certified Residential Specialist (CRS) designation, which is the highest credential awarded to residential sales agents, managers and brokers. Only 3% of all REALTORS® have obtained this designation.

Personal Interests

Leslie and her husband are huge college football and basketball fans and regularly attend games at their alma mater, the University of Colorado. She also enjoys traveling and learning about American History.

Specialties

Seller Representation
Buyer Representation
First Time Home Buyers
First Time Home Sellers
Luxury Homes
Real Estate Negotiation
Relocation to Denver
New Home Sales
Real Estate Investing
Single Family Homes
Condo/Town Homes
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Born and raised in Denver, Libby’s expansive knowledge of the city and her insights into each neighborhood helps her clients immeasurably. Libby began her career in real estate in 2005 and was delighted to join Kentwood Real Estate in 2006, working with other top producing agents in the Denver area.

Libby has been recognized by the Denver Metro Association of Realtors (DMAR) for excellence in the industry by sales and transaction volume. She has been prominently featured discussing the real estate market in over 30 Denver news segments, nationally syndicated newspapers, a TV commercial, and numerous magazines. She has earned the highest credentials in residential real estate: Certified Residential Specialist, Graduate Realtor Institute and Certified International Property Specialist.  Libby has been actively involved in leadership positions with the National Association of Realtors and Colorado Association of Realtors.  Additionally, she served as the Director of the Board for DMAR and chaired the influential Market Trends Committee which provides data and insights for real estate professionals across the state. 

Libby is known for her ability to facilitate smooth and profitable transactions for her clients. With extensive understanding of the nuances of Denver’s ever-evolving market.  Libby’s vast background encompasses luxury property, new construction and investments.   With a strong work ethic, innate ability to connect with others, and an analytical mind, it’s no wonder that her clients return to work with her time and time again.  

As a gifted designer in her own right, Libby has the vision to help her clients choose thoughtful investments with well considered updates over time.  Digital marketing is a key communications strategy for Libby.  Her communications and business degrees from the University of Colorado at Boulder enables her to create personalized and sophisticated marketing materials for her clients while her enviable social media presence and blog, Lifestyle Denver, has inspired many of her clients with profitable upgrades.  Ultimately, it is Libby's knowledge and ties to the community, both professionally and personally that set her apart.

In 2021, Libby teamed with Elizabeth Sacerdoti to create Vesta Homes at Kentwood Real Estate, with the shared vision of offering clients a level of service, experience and market knowledge rarely seen in the real estate industry. Since the inception of Vesta Homes, Libby and Elizabeth have been recognized as one of the top teams across the metropolitan area.  In Libby’s free time, she loves traveling to new cities and old favorites, like London and Edinburgh.  She enjoys planning her next adventure with her family - or studying the latest design trends.
title: Broker Associate, GRI, CRS, CIPS

description:
Linda Hantman is consistently ranked among Denver’s top 1% of Realtors, and for the past ten consecutive years she has been recognized by DMAR’s Million Dollar Roundtable for superior sales production.

As a Colorado native with a 15 year track record of success, Linda combines extraordinary market knowledge with a passion for personalized service.  She works tirelessly to exceed her client’s expectations and has built a reputation for discretion, integrity, design skills and vision.

Linda Hantman earned her bachelor’s degree from the University of Kansas and chose Kentwood Real Estate because of the company’s leading market position. Her parents both had careers in Commercial and Residential Real Estate in Denver.

Linda and her husband Peter have two girls, 22 and 20. She enjoys skiing, tennis, travel, and spending time with her family.

For more information on real estate services from Linda Hantman, phone 720-298-1266, or contact Linda via email at linda.hantman@denverrealestate.com
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description: Lisa has lived in beautiful Colorado for over 30 years. Deeply rooted in the Northern Colorado community, she brings a wealth of local knowledge and a passion for helping others to every real estate transaction. As a dedicated member of the Fort Collins Board of REALTORS®, she is committed to providing exceptional service to buyers and sellers alike. Lisa is not just a trusted agent – she’s a mom, wife, and friend. She and her husband have two incredible children and one little red fluffy dog, Winnie. Lisa takes pride in building long lasting relationships with her clients. She listens to their needs and ensures clear, open communication throughout every step of the buying or selling process. She understands that real estate is more than just transactions – it’s about helping people move forward into their next chapter. “It’s important to me that my clients feel supported and know I’m always here for them. Their goals are my top priority” Whether you’re buying your dream home, selling a property, or exploring new opportunities, Lisa is dedicated to making your experience seamless and stress-free. With her local expertise, strong work ethic, and unwavering commitment to customer service, she’s ready to guide you toward your next adventure with confidence.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Lori Pace by way of Jamaica, West Indies has built her life and career in Denver for 30 years. She has an appreciation for buildings and entrepreneurship influenced by her father who is a successful architect and instrumental in numerous historic landmark projects in Denver. Lori has a degree in Environmental Design with a concentration in Architecture and Urban Planning. She began her career with the Denver Urban Renewal Authority dedicated to neighborhood revitalization and redevelopment and has designed community engagement programs for neighborhoods and brokerages to combat the negative impacts of gentrification on urban communities.
