Lori has been involved in public and private collaborations of Real Estate Acquisitions and Community Development which serves as the core foundation of her background.  Lori's professional training in real estate, neighborhood revitalization/development, leadership, and sales has created an understanding of the multiple facets of the industry. She has been representing buyers and sellers in transactions involving land, residential homes, commercial buildings, and retail projects including mixed-use developments.

Lori is a keynote speaker and trainer on Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace with an emphasis on the real estate industry. Her passion for real estate has culminated in her serving as a Board of Director of The Denver Metropolitan Association of Realtors and a founding member of the Community Alliance Committee which advocates for supporting affiliated multicultural Real Estate Associations.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Managing Broker of the Year 2019 - DMAR

Luisa began her real estate career in 1985 in Denver, Colorado. In marketing fine properties, Luisa is consistently a top producer. Currently she specializes in Cherry Hills Village, Greenwood Village, Denver Country Club, Polo Grounds, Hilltop, Cherry Creek and Lower Downtown (“LoDo”)  loft and condominium market.

Born and raised in Denver, Luisa received her undergraduate degree from Regis University in Denver in 1975 and her Masters degree from the University of Colorado in 1980.

Luisa is a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors, The Colorado Association of Realtors, and the National Association of Realtors. She has been a member of the Million Dollar Roundtable consistently. Actively involved in the community, and serves as a member of the Board of Trustees for Regis University in Denver.

In 1988 Luisa became a principal of The Devonshire Company and held the position as Managing Partner for many years. In 2007, Luisa joined Kentwood Real Estate in the Denver Tech Center as the Managing Broker where she utilized her superior real estate knowledge, marketing skills and a vast knowledge of the Metro Denver real estate market including particular expertise marketing luxury homes. Luisa continues to use her many years of experience to serve her clients.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Mac Martin is a proud Asian American with a rich cultural background and a unique journey. As the youngest sibling in a large family, Mac grew up overseas, surrounded by abundant support and inspiration that shaped his character. Known for his creativity, determination, attention to detail, and tireless work ethic, Mac embraces challenges with enthusiasm and thrives in demanding environments.

In the mid-90s, Mac pursued an opportunity which relocated him from bustling San Francisco to the serene surroundings of Boulder, Colorado. Mac has never looked back, cherishing Colorado's often surprising weather, distinct seasons, and a healthy lifestyle.
 
Mac’s passion for real estate blossomed as he discovered his talent for helping others find homes where they could thrive. He has a deep appreciation for historic architecture paired with modern finishes, reflecting his love for design and attention to detail. As a volunteer resident on the Baker Historic Neighborhood Zoning Committee, Mac gained valuable insight into Denver’s zoning and variance guidelines, allowing him to balance the city’s urban character with its historical significance and future potential.
 
Mac is also affiliated with various local organizations, including the Asian Real Estate Association of America (AREAA) Denver chapter and the Filipino American Community of Colorado. In addition to his work and community involvement, Mac enjoys snowboarding and skiing, while the summer beckons him to explore the great outdoors through mountain biking and hiking. In between, he indulges his passion for travel and wildlife photography, often in the company of his siblings.  Currently, Mac and his partner call Riverfront Park Community their home, where they enjoy friends at Commons Park, accompanied by their cherished dogs, Gigi, Charlie and Ray.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, RSPS

description:
Martha Potter-Goldstein is an award-winning real estate professional with 46 years of high profile experience. She is a member of the Denver Board of Realtors and has garnered top sales awards for real estate production for 43 years. 

Martha earned her real estate license in 1978 and currently serves the diverse real estate needs of clients throughout the greater Denver area’s most prestigious and historic neighborhoods, in addition to the South Metro neighborhoods of Greenwood and Cherry Hills Village and rural equestrian communities.  She holds the Certified Residential Specialist designation.

Martha has served as a commissioner for Greenwood Village Parks & Trails department in the past for several years and generously donates her time and money to numerous worthwhile charities.  She earned her B.A. degree in Land Use Management from the University of Colorado and completed graduate studies in Medical Illustration. 

Martha enjoys art, design, animals of all kinds, equestrian sports, skiing, gardening, airplanes, and loves to continue to learn all sorts of things. She has a background in Land Use Management and the oil, gas & minerals business, as well, which comes in handy for her rural clients.

            “I am pleased to be an integral part of the top-producing team of real estate professionals at Kentwood Real Estate,” Martha said. “My business philosophy has always entailed top quality service, treating clients as I wish to be treated myself.  My client’s interests come first, and I strive diligently to provide a seamless real estate transaction that is both timely and rewarding. I choose Kentwood Real Estate due to its great marketing programs, top quality agents, and the vast resources and numerous advantages the company provides my clients.”
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
As a Denver native with over two decades of experience in real estate, Mary is more than just an agent—she's a trusted friend and advocate for her clients. With an intimate understanding of the Denver market, Mary ensures that every home buying or selling journey is not only successful but also enjoyable and stress-free.

As a longstanding Top Producer at Kentwood Real Estate, Mary's success speaks for itself, with over 98% of her business coming from referrals from her satisfied clients. Her genuine passion for helping people shines through in every transaction, making the process both exciting, fun and emotionally rewarding.

Mary believes wholeheartedly in providing exceptional service to all, regardless of price point. While she excels in every aspect of real estate, her expertise truly shines in the luxury home market. With a keen understanding of its unique challenges, Mary approaches each transaction with creativity and finesse, ensuring her clients achieve outstanding results.

Outside of work, Mary treasures her time with her husband of 39 years on the golf course and cherishes moments spent with her children, and her beloved grandbabies. Whether she's entertaining friends, exploring new restaurants, or adventuring to exciting destinations, Mary's zest for life is infectious, and her warmth and generosity extend far beyond the closing table.

AFFILIATIONS • AWARDS

CRS, DMAR, CAR, NAR
title: Broker Associate, CRS, CNE

description:
Living and working in the Denver and Boulder areas contributed to my exceptional knowledge of both communities. Attending the University of Colorado at Boulder framed my love for the town, and I still spend much of my free time visiting the city and helping real estate purchasers and sellers there.

The first home I purchased was in Denver's historic Montclair neighborhood; centrally located near my Kentwood office in Cherry Creek allowing me to concentrate on the areas of Stapleton, Lowry, Park Hill and more specifically Montclair. When my business began drawing me more and more to the north metro area, and seeing the rapid growth in that quadrant, I moved back to Erie in 2016, where my real estate career began.
 
Since then, I have worked to cultivate an encyclopedic knowledge of where the greater community is and where it is going. I pride myself on being one of the first to know what and when new projects are coming to the area. I have an understanding of the unique pros and cons of each neighborhood in and around the Erie area, with a particular knowledge of Colliers Hill, where we make our home.

As a lifelong sports enthusiast, I played baseball and rugby collegiately. Now I expend the passion and energy required to excel in sports, to ensure that each client receives the uncompromising professionalism necessary to find their ideal home or obtain the highest value for an existing home. An enjoyment of sabermetrics in baseball has translated to a passion and proficiency for spotting and analyzing values and trends in the market place that give my clients an edge in making their real estate decisions and transactions.

The critical responsibilities inherent with helping people make the most important decision of their lives is taken seriously. Whether it means that I strap on my boots and hike over 30 mountain acres or work into the wee hours of the morning, I am going to make sure you have the right information to make the best decision possible. I accept that trust and wouldn't be happier doing anything else. Let me know how I can be of service to you with your next big decision!
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Matt Peterson is a Broker that focuses on residential leasing. Matt serves as an internim between Owners and sourcing great long term tenants. Prior to joining Kentwood, he worked at Calibrate Real Estate and Zephyr Real Estate Services where he leased everything from small one bedrooms to large luxury homes. Matt’s main focus is Central Denver, but does work throughout the Metro Area.

EDUCATION 

Licensed Colorado Real Estate Agent (2014)
University of Colorado Denver, BFA (2007)

PERSONAL 

Matt lives in Southeast Denver with his wife and daughter. He moved to Denver in 2002 and just can’t seem to leave. In his down time you can find him struggling on the golf course or escaping the city noise in the Colorado mountains.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Hi, I’m Meg Dworak—a passionate professional seamlessly blending the art of luxury real estate with the transformative power of design. As a seasoned Realtor and graduate of the prestigious Parsons School of Design in New York with a BA in Environmental Design, I bring an unparalleled perspective to the high-end property market. My expertise lies in recognizing the untapped potential of each space, creating homes that are as elegant as they are functional.

My approach to everything real estate is rooted in a deep understanding of lifestyle aesthetics and functionality. I don’t just see properties; I see the possibilities. Whether it's an opulent penthouse, a historic estate, or a modern masterpiece, I help clients envision spaces that elevate their lifestyle while reflecting their personal style.

Luxury Real Estate is a Full-Service business experience, regardless of the price which requires precision and expertise. From exclusive listings to bespoke buying experiences, I specialize in aligning your lifestyle aspirations with the perfect property.

Whether you’re selling a distinguished home, searching for a dream estate, or making a strategic investment, I offer unparalleled service tailored to your needs.

I stay at the forefront of market trends and emerging design concepts, ensuring my clients benefit from cutting-edge strategies and ideas. My ability to blend design enhancements with real estate insights helps unlock each property’s full potential, I am your trusted partner in creating exceptional living experiences.

Let’s embark on this journey together, redefining luxury living and crafting homes that truly inspire. Welcome to a world where real estate meets design at the highest level of elegance and possibility.
title: Realtor®, GRI, ABR

description:
I’m a true local, Colorado advocate, with a thorough lay of the land. I grew up in Greenwood Village, graduated from CSU Fort Collins, and have established my roots here in Wash Park.

I started my real estate journey in high-end property management, which has given me endless knowledge on home functions and how to maintain a healthy property. I practice what I preach, which is building wealth through real estate, and own a few investments myself. I can help you spot a good investment and how to create one.

You’ll find, in any transaction with me, I treat you as I would want to be treated. Personalized with the utmost honesty, knowledge, and communication. As a Kentwood broker, I can offer a wealth of knowledge and support to get you to the closing table.

Alongside my real estate career, I have built a complimentary staging business - Fox Co Interiors. Fox Co was born out of a passion for design and established with the vision to provide a full-service home sale experience. With over 100 stages under my belt, I have a great equation for getting any home ready for the market.

When I’m not catering to the demands of the profession, I’m exploring the state with my husband and friends through food and the outdoors. I would love to chat about your favorite ski slope, mountain bike trail, yoga studio, or, most importantly, restaurant.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Meet Meredith Hotz. She's a Broker associate who lives and works in the Denver suburbs. She sells Denver real estate thoughout the suburbs  and  downtown neighborhoods. She's a member of The Hotz Group Realtors with veteran Broker Larry Hotz and her sister Elizabeth.

Denver Real Estate Blog

While her family has been selling luxury Denver real estate since 1978, Meredith concentrates on serving buyers and sellers in all price ranges. In addition to be being a member of the National Association of Realtors, she is also a Certified Military Specialist.

Also, she she a regular contirbutor to Denver's top-ranked real estate Blog. All Denver Real Estate covers homes, lifestyles and Denver neighborhoods. Meredith loves to share her real estate experiences on that popular blog.

She's become an expert in submitting offers to buy homes when her clients face multiple offer situations. "I make a practice to investigate how may offers and what kinid of terms we face in every different situation:, Meredith says.

"I've had to submit multiple offers for clients when we are competing with up to 12 other offers." Meredith explains. "I've found communication with the listing broker is the key. Sometimes, we have even been able to be the winning offer without being the highest price. Of course, it doesn't hurt that the Hotz name is well known among Denver real estate agents".

Search the Denver MLS

"Searching the Denver MLS alone is not the best way to find new listings. National portals like Zillow have many old listings that are not even still for sale. However, our website All Denver Real Estate offers all current Denver MLS listings and its actually updated with new listings for sale every 15 minutes. Plus, I can sometimes find listings to show that aren't even in the Denver MLS through my office and broker connections." By the way, Be sure to check our own mobile application for Denver home searches. We think its better than others and we do not sell yur date, ever!

Lives in Denver Suburbs

Meredith grew up in Cherry Hills where she attended the Cherry Creek schools including Cherry Hills Village Elementary, West Middle School and the Cherry Creek High School. Following high school, she attend college at Colorado State University.

Meredith purchased her first home in southern suburb of Aurora in 2013 . Most people don't even know that southern Aurora in the top-rated Cherry Creek School District and offers an easy commute the the Denver Tech Center where Meredith works at the Kentwood Company.

Expert in Highlands Ranch, Southern Aurora and Littleton

Meredith also lived in the Denver suburbs of Highlands Ranch, Co. She now resides in Littleton. So, she knows the south suburbs of Denver like the back of her hand.

Meredith has found that southern Aurora and Highlands Ranch popular with Denver Relocation Buyers. Relocation often involves finding a great school district with affordable homes.

Her first home in southern Aurora appreciated quickly. So, she was able to move-up within just 3 years.

"We never could have afforded the home in Highlands Ranch if we hadn't first bought the South Aurora home." Meredith explains. "The equity from the old house literally bought us a part of our new home in just 3 years. You've got to start somewhere with home ownership!"

The Hotz Group

Meredith has been selling real estate since 2015 with The Hotz Group. She works with her sister, Elizabeth, pictured below, and her Dad, Larry Hotz. Together, they practice real estate at Kentwood Real Estate as The Hotz Group. They enjoy working together as a team. And, they average over $50m in annual home sales. 

Meredith grew up in a real estate family. Both her Dad and Uncle have been Denver Realtor's since she can remember. And, sister Elizabeth has been selling homes since 2005.

"I guess it's in my blood", says Meredith. "I love going out of my way to help people. I am passionate about helping my clients get the best home and the best possible price. I've been watching my Dad do that since I was born. Maybe got the real estate bug by osmosis!"

In her spare time, Meredith loves traveling, camping and helping to host Charity Events. She's been very involved in Families First since high school. Meredith graduated from Colorado State University and Cherry Creek High School. She's a member of the Colorado Assocation of Realtors and the National Association of Realtors as well as the Metro Denver Association of Realtors.

Call Meredith and find out for yourself how she can help you. She's love to hear from you!

Denver Relocation Realtors, Elizabeth, Larry and Meredith Hotz.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Mike is an extremely passionate and highly experienced Realtor with a focus on residential and multi-family sales in Denver and the surrounding areas. He started his career in commercial real estate with Marcus & Millichap on the investment side. There he worked on the retail team with a primary focus on Triple-Net Automotive (NNN). After a brief time on the institutional side of commercial real estate he had an opportunity to join Unique Properties, a boutique investment company in Denver. There he was able to gain incredible insight and mentorship by working directly for the two founding principles with a focus on multi-family. Following his tenure at Unique Mike decided to deepen his already extensive knowledge of the built environment and how to invest in it by attending graduate school at the University of Denver. Upon completion he received two degrees, one in Real Estate and Construction Management (MS-RECM) and the other in Finance (MS-Finance). Mike then proceeded to receive his employing broker license in Colorado and start his own investment company/brokerage house - Bruin Development in 2008. Through Bruin Development from 2008-2020 Mike began his personal investment career including Fix-and-Flips, Redevelopments, Tax-Liens, Foreclosures, Private Notes, Auctions, Rentals, and Hard Money Lending. After several years of doing private residential investments Mike started a construction company, READS, Inc. This enabled Mike to further facilitate his real estate investing by becoming a licensed General Contractor. Mike's extensive background in both the built environment and real estate investing spans almost two decades and multiple economic cycles. He has honed his skill set as a "value-add" investor and Realtor through his ability to identify multiple exit strategies allowing for a more creative and flexible approach to real estate investing. He is known for his unwavering commitment to his clients' success and specializes in “hunting” off-market properties, demonstrating a proactive approach to real estate transactions. 

One of Michael's distinguishing features is his dedication to his craft as a salesman, Realtor, and investor. He has a life-long commitment to education and expanding his knowledge base when it comes to real estate. The breadth and diversity of Mike’s background equips him to provide exceptional service to his clients. This level of commitment not only sets him apart from his peers but also fosters strong loyalty among his clients. His passion for empowering clients to build wealth through real estate further underscores his client-centric approach. 

Mike is a proud father and husband. His two kids, Dylan and Pablo, his wife Brandis and his dog Dizzy all live in the East Denver neighborhood of Mayfair. Mike is an avid outdoorsman who enjoys skiing, fly-fishing, golfing, paddleboarding, gardening and anything done in water. When not outside he enjoys reading, woodworking, and all things University of Kansas Jayhawks & DU Pioneers.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Michael Larson began his career in real estate in 2024 after almost 10 years in the healthcare industry. Michael has been familiar with the real estate business his entire life due to his father’s career with Kentwood Real Estate. Michael has a Bachelor of Science degree in Exercise Science and a minor in Korean, as well as a Master of Science degree in Healthcare Administration from Oklahoma State University.

Michael’s passion for hard work, service to others, and integrity make him a great asset to his clients’ dreams and aspirations in the real estate market. Michael has seen the ebb and flow of the real estate market as a Colorado native and is here to navigate and assist his clients in the decision that best suits their needs. Paramount to Michael’s approach to his clients is dutiful diligence and transparent communication so his clients have the necessary information to make the best decision to meet their specific needs.

Michael and his wife Aubrey have 3 daughters; ages 6, 5, and 17 months, and 2 dogs, and reside in Highlands Ranch. Michael loves spending his free time with his wife and children in the beautiful Colorado outdoors.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Growing up in Arvada, Colorado, I’ve always had a deep connection to this state and a passion for the people who choose to call it home. I believe in the power of community and the importance of supporting those around me. My career path has been shaped by a strong desire to see my friends, family, and clients succeed. 

To me, real estate is more than just buying and selling properties—it’s about providing the flexibility and security that can truly change lives. I’ve witnessed firsthand how owning real estate can create opportunities, reduce struggles, and set people up for long-term success. This is why I’m so passionate about helping first-time homebuyers and anyone looking to build a better future through real estate. 

I’m driven by the belief that the American dream is built on the foundation of homeownership. My clients are not just transactions to me; they’re friends—people I genuinely care about and want to see thrive. Every relationship I build in this industry is one I value deeply, and I’m committed to being there for my clients, providing guidance and support throughout the entire process. 

At Kentwood Real Estate, my mission is simple: I want to ensure that the people I work with and choose to build relationships with are happy and confident in the decision they make. 

Outside of real estate, I have a deep love for cars and exploring the culinary scene. In fact, I’d probably travel for food before I’d travel for the destination—I find that some of life’s most exciting moments are around a table! These passions keep me energized and remind me of the importance of enjoying life’s journey, both personally and professionally. 

I believe in the power of homeownership to transform lives, and I’m passionate about helping my clients achieve the success and stability they deserve. When you work with me, you’re not just another client—you’re a valued friend, and I’m committed to being there for you every step of the way.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
The Schlifkin Team has more than 36 years of combined real estate experience.  Their vast knowledge and experience with the market, trends, transactions, neighborhoods and marketing places them among the nation's elite real estate professionals.  They are consistently ranked among the top agents in the nation and have helped thousands of families buy and/or sell a home. 

The Schlifkin Team has founded their business on the commitment that their clients deserve the highest level of personal service and attention.  Much of their success can be attributed to total customer satisfaction resulting in referrals and repeat clients year after year.

Mitch Rothman has been in real estate for nearly 6 years on both the residential and commercial sides.  He has also been awarded Platinum Level recognition.  Mitch specializes in Lowry, as well as the entire Denver area including Colorado Springs, Evergreen, Broomfield, Lafayette and Boulder. He was born in New Jersey and graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder with a Bachelor of Science in Journalism.  He also holds an MBA in Marketing from Fordham University.  Rothman serves on the Collaborative School Committee for Lowry Elementary School.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Nancy’s passion and attention to detail is to help Sellers get the most value for their home and assist Buyers in a highly-focused search for their ideal new residence.  Her professionalism, knowledge and exceptional customer service has resulted in an expanding network of loyal customers and referrals.

Nancy’s diverse background has helped her achieve great success in the highly competitive real estate business for over 25 years.  She has been able to fulfill the real estate needs and desires of her clients while providing seamless and rewarding experiences that create lifetime relationships.  Her background includes public relations, marketing, sales, advertising, negotiating contracts, creating sales campaigns, and conducting market research.  This varied experience is directly responsible for placing Nancy among the upper echelon of real estate brokers nationally. 

As a consistent top producer since 1992, and a leading Broker Associate with Kentwood Real Estate, Nancy has garnered numerous prestigious awards annually for outstanding sales production including recognition from the Denver Board of Realtors, as wells as acknowledgment as a Five Star Real Estate Professional.  Her knowledge of metro Denver’s neighborhoods is extensive.  She has sold homes in Cherry Hills, Greenwood Village, Centennial, Washington Park, Country Club, Park Hill, Cherry Creek, Observatory Park, LoDo, The Highlands, Uptown Denver, Castle Pines and more.

Nancy’s commitment to the Denver community is evidenced by her passionate involvement with some of the most important organizations in the region. She is a proud supporter of the High Line Canal Conservancy. Actively helping preserve, protect, and enhance 71 miles of cherished greenway throughout Denver. She also shows her commitment with diverse charities such as Project Cure; organizing donations of medical supplies distributed worldwide and feeding the homeless at the Denver Rescue Mission. Having raised three children, she has actively volunteered in the Cherry Creek School district.

Nancy’s husband, Andy, is an accomplished architect who has helped her appreciate the qualities inherent to a quality home.  Activities Nancy enjoys with her family include traveling, the arts, skiing, tennis, paddle ball and all Colorado’s amazing outdoor activities.  She also enjoys spending time socializing with old and new friends.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Nancy Walters, a Denver metro area real estate professional, specializes in buying and selling residential real estate across the Denver metro area, including many golf communities. Her reputation in this market is unmatched, guiding clients with care and precision. As your real estate agent, Nancy ensures a tailored approach. And, as the Co-Owner of two prestigious luxury magazines, AvidLlifestyle and Colorado AvidGolfer Magazines, Nancy understands the finer aspects of living which translates into a seamless and luxury experience for her clients. 

Joining Kentwood Real Estate in 2017 was a natural choice for Nancy, as she knew the reputation of the company would best align with the expectations of quality service, experience, support and community leadership Nancy would expect for herself and her clients.  Her deep knowledge of diverse personalities helps clients at every stage of home ownership and you can always expect personalized guidance, whether finding the perfect golf community home or preparing a property for sale in any neighborhood. As a real estate agent with a keen eye for design and a vision for remodeling, Nancy can help her clients see the potential in every property! 

Beyond transactions, Nancy builds lasting relationships, offering guidance, resources and opportunities based on her real estate experience. Her dedication to understanding client needs, combined with her vast experience, leads to finding a dream home or selling property on the best terms for her clients. Nancy resides in Greenwood Village with her husband, Allen, and enjoys playing golf, entertaining and dining out with friends and clients, and traveling all over the world.  She and Allen especially enjoy visiting their children, Erica (Salt Lake City) and Jason (London UK).
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Nicole is a Colorado native who grew up in Highlands Ranch and couldn't be happier to call Colorado her home! She has traveled to 43 states, and none of them offers the lifestyle that Colorado does. During her childhood, Nicole's Dad worked as a lender and spent a lot of time working from their home. She was able to assist him with all aspects of his business, gradually gaining insights into the complex world of Real Estate from a lender's perspective. After her dad's 25+ years in the business, he transitioned from a desk job to rehabbing homes in the Denver Metro Area. At that point, it was only natural for Nicole to obtain her license and start working alongside her Dad, renovating and selling homes. It was scary to venture into something new after years of working for a Sports Marketing company, but she took the plunge because sticking to the status quo was even scarier.

Nicole has been licensed for 10 years and has assisted over 200 families in finding their first home, selling their childhood homes, purchasing their next investment property, or moving into their dream house. She is also a proud mom to a 2.5-year-old son and a loving wife to her husband, Shawn. Whether you're buying or selling a home, it's a deeply personal experience. It could be the home you've always dreamed of buying or your childhood home filled with memories. In any case, Nicole cares about what that home means to you. She takes the time to get to know her clients and cultivate lifelong friendships because real estate is a personal business, and her clients are the most important aspect to her.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Nori’s real estate career spans both the commercial and residential arenas. Growing up in a Denver real estate investment family, Nori’s education and interest in real estate started in early childhood and eventually propelled her to attain a bachelor’s degree in real estate from the University of Denver.

Nori’s real estate career began with the global investment management firm BlackRock in Newport Beach, California, where she worked in commercial real estate asset management (mainly apartments) in various submarkets throughout Southern California and Texas. Nori says the most valuable takeaway from her time with BlackRock was entering into the position in early 2008, just before the start of the Great Recession. “Working through a notoriously difficult period in real estate at the very start of my career gave me invaluable insight and experience that I have been able to apply throughout my entire career in real estate,” says Nori.

Nori’s subsequent positions in real estate have all been local to Colorado; having worked in the beautiful Vail Valley with Slifer Smith & Frampton Real Estate (residential brokerage) and most recently working as the director of operations for a small commercial real estate private equity firm, specializing mainly in apartment syndications. 

Outside of work, Nori loves spending time with her energetic 6-year old boy running from one sport to the next and getting a “master’s” education on all things Marvel Superheroes and the NFL.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Oisin isn't just a local advisor but an international partner. He currently specializes in residential sales in Denver and the Front Range, and works full time to help his clients successfully buy, sell, and invest in real estate.

As a dual US Canadian citizen, and growing up living all over the world, Oisin has developed a keen insight into analyzing, advising and connecting his clients globally. Whether he's forging connections within his network of advisors and industry contacts locally, across the United States, or globally, rest assured that all your real estate requirements are in capable hands.

With more than two decades of experience as a real estate investor and nearly a decade serving as a trusted local advisor in Denver, Oisin has consistently assisted clients in making astute investments. His expertise includes adept negotiation skills and navigating the complexities of real estate transactions with seasoned confidence. He also held industry positions as a manager, business director, expansion partner, development coordinator and investment analyst.

Outside of real estate, Oisin’s is also an aficionado of architecture and design history and spends personal time saving and restoring historic homes. He has a love of cooking international foods, adventure travel, local charity work and the arts. You will catch him spending his free time pursuing these interests with his family and friends and also exploring the mountains and city life.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Pamela Cass is a passionate, dedicated, and highly skilled realtor who has been serving the Northern Colorado area since 2007. Her extensive real estate career spans over 16 years, during which time she has built an impeccable reputation for her personalized services and industry expertise.

Having a deep understanding of the Northern Colorado market, Pamela has successfully navigated through various market conditions, always ensuring her clients achieve their property goals. Her proven track record in helping both buyers and sellers, from first-time homeowners to seasoned property investors, speaks to her breadth of knowledge and versatility in the industry.

Known for her strategic market insight, meticulous attention to detail, and a relentless work ethic, Pamela has quickly become a go-to resource in the local real estate industry. Her commitment to going above and beyond for her clients is well-acknowledged and has garnered her a significant client base predominantly built on referrals and repeat business.

Pamela utilizes her intimate knowledge of the region to provide her clients with unmatched, insightful advice. She is passionate about helping people find not just a house, but a home, where they can create lasting memories.

When she’s not helping clients navigate the real estate landscape, Pamela loves to explore the natural beauty of Northern Colorado with her family. Her deep connection to the community is evident in his active participation in local events and initiatives, reinforcing her status as more than just a realtor, but a trusted community figure.

Pamela Cass: Your partner in navigating the Northern Colorado real estate market, turning real estate dreams into reality since 2007.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, CNE, CTA

description:
I enjoy everything that this amazing city has to offer, especially golfing amidst the most scenic views.  I am also extremely passionate about being a great leader for my family and strive to spend as much time with them as possible.

My love for real estate is rooted in a desire to make a difference in others' lives.  Whether a first-time home buyer, seller or seasoned investor, I always put my clients' interests above all.  I do so with exceptional service, distinguished energy, and unwavering integrity because it's about much more than a sale for me. It's about the value I can provide for every client every time."
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Patty and Greg have been partners, and have been working in their real estate business together for nearly 25 years. Their formula for success is tried and true, giving this dynamic duo a reputation that exceeds all their client's expectations. They continue to be top producers in the Denver market mostly due to their diligent work ethic, creative vision in preparing every listing, attention to contractual detail, and stellar listening and follow-through skills. Time and time again, their clients cannot emphasize enough Patty and Greg's quality of service by making the real estate transaction a positive experience, whether buying or selling. Their many testimonials, without a doubt, speak for themselves, with the majority of their business being their satisfied past clients and referrals.

While living in Washington Park for over 2 decades, and mostly working in the Denver area, Patty and Greg also spend time in Steamboat Springs and are proficient with the market there working with their Denver second-time home buyers. As well, they love spending time skiing, hiking, fishing, going to concerts, and spending quality time with their kids and 4 grandchildren!

In the end, whether selling or purchasing a home, Patty and Greg’s client testimonials speak for themselves. Click on the link, and witness for yourself! - Click for Testimonials
title: Broker Associates, Realtors®

description:
2020 marks Pat Wall’s 42nd year in residential real estate.

In May, she was awarded the prestigious Realtor Emeritus designation by the National Association of Realtors.

This honor is for the select few brokers who have  been NAR members for 40 years and given  back to the industry. She has had a career of 4 decades as a "Top Producer". Receiving honors as a DMAR Excellence Award winner and 5 Star Professional every  year.  Her other designations are GRI ( Graduate of Realtor Institute) MRE ( Masters in Real Estate) CRS ( Council of  Residential Specialists) and in 2017  the SRS ( Seller Representative Specialist ).

 Her career started in 1977 at Van Schaack & Company  in Cherry Creek.  In 1990, she joined her colleagues who had formed The Kentwood Company.  Pat is a Denver native and alum of the University of Colorado (chemistry).  Her background is in the apparel industry (retail, wholesale & manufacturing her own  clothing company: PAT ON THE BACK in Los Angeles.) This accounts for her excellent business knowledge and negotiating  skills.  Known for her creative marketing  campaigns—she just launched her new website: cherrycreekrestaurants.com. The site is  a continuation of her first promotional campaign from 1979 based on her list of Cherry Creek restaurants. The new website features her  famous list of restaurants plus access to active listings. “Where is THE CHERRY” is Pat’s trademarked social media  campaign that follows a 3 foot tall cherry around Cherry Creek.   

She has served  on the Board of Directors  for Hilltop and University Park. In 2000 she started the University Park Home Tour. Her expertise extends from Cherry Creek to Cherry Hills.

She is adamant about real estate as the vehicle for funding a college education. Ask her about Wall College Fund LLC.

Her years have taught her there is a better way to prepare her clients. She strives to make her sellers the best in the market with programs  like Target  Date Marketing and the Good Home Guarantee.  According to Kentwood Managing Broker, Brandon Brennick: “Pat does the details so well. Her uncanny ability to price property and keen sense of telling a home’s story have made her and her clients very successful!”

Pat’s Mother was a real estate  broker and helped Pat purchase her first home at 20. Pat’s son, Peter is a lobbyist and represents Denver Metro Association of Realtors. Peter received an award presented by Mayor Hancock in 2017 for his service as Governmental Affairs Director for DMAR.
title: Broker Associate, GRI, CRS, MRE, SRS, Emeritus Status

description:
Growing up in rural Ohio, I couldn’t wait to escape to the big city of Los Angeles. After 25 years of all that a big city offered, I came back to my roots – small town Colorado.

My family and I have been living in Boulder County since 2001, and prior to that we lived in the southern suburbs of Denver. We couldn’t be happier in Boulder County as it’s a wonderful fit. We love the mountain views of Longs Peak, the quaint mining towns, and open spaces.

When I moved to California, I was star struck. I immediately put my administrative skills, which I honed at the University of Kentucky, to good use and worked in or around the film industry until 1976, when I discovered real estate. I met my husband, who was a fellow Realtor, in 1980 and our son was born in 1985. In California, I was very involved, and a founding board member of, Camp Ronald McDonald for Good Times, which was one of the first camps for children and families of children with cancer, as well as President of the First Christian Church Nursery School, Vice President of the Carpenter Avenue PTA and school volunteer. After coming to Colorado, I have participated in the AIDS walk, Bolder Boulder and volunteered at Dressed for Success.

I love real estate. I take a personal interest in my clients and many of them have become extremely close friends throughout my career. With all the internet sites and cyber feeds out there, clients still need to know they have a human being that is taking care of them and watching out for them. I am proud of the repeat business and referrals I have attained and the exceptional customer satisfaction.

I specialize in the Boulder County area and northern suburbs of Denver. However, since my first seven years in Colorado were spent in Littleton, I continue to service clients in and around Denver as well.  Having lived in Niwot and currently living in Erie, I am part of the community. The eastern portion of Boulder County is expanding tremendously, while the Boulder area remains protected by open space, with homeowners expanding and updating existing properties.

Since 2000, I have been associated with Kentwood Real Estate, one of the premier real estate offices in the nation. I can’t imagine working anywhere else. The respect this company demands makes me proud to be a member of this firm.

Sellers and purchasers alike, whether they are dealing in starter condominiums or multi-million-dollar estates, know “They have a friend in me.”
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, CRS

description:
Over the past 30+ years Peter has specialized in the marketing and sales of homes, condominiums, lofts, townhomes, building conversions, and luxury high rise units in Denver. He has established himself as a respected resource and expert in the sales and market trends in historic urban neighborhoods such as Capitol Hill, Cheesman Park, Cherry Creek, Congress Park, Downtown, Golden Triangle, Uptown, and LoDo. Additionally, Peter is experienced with historic condominium and single family properties. 

In addition to being a full time real estate professional, Peter is also a reputable and well respected real estate market analyst consultant. He has been licensed in multiple states. He has generated new development deals site location for real estate development companies that focus on multi-family residential projects, including real-estate market analysis and Strategic Consulting. Specializing in Urban neighborhoods, historic properties, their preservation and best use. Performing total market, micro research and reports on Denver's Condominium Market, along with market feasibility studies, marketing and consulting for a diversified Clientele on condominium projects and conversions (4-250 units).  

Specializations: Condos, Lofts, Urban Properties, Historic Properties, Exchanges, Equestrian,  International Properties, Equestrian Farms, Equestrian Rentals, Farm/Ranch Luxury, Luxury Rentals

Interests/Experience: Former National/International Grand Prix Level Rider/Young Sport Horse Trainer 

Gallery Owner/Dealer: Dealing in quality historic Native American arts from all cultural regions including baskets, beadwork, and unique objects, Pueblo pottery, Navajo paintings, Navajo weavings, baskets and vintage Navajo, Hopi, Zuni jewelry, Old Pawn jewelry, bits and bridals, Spanish colonial art, antiques artifacts including Santos, Retablos, Mexican folk, Talavera pottery, textiles as well as quality artworks of contemporary and emerging artists.
title: Realtor®, CNE, CIPS, RSPS, RENE

description: Buyers choose Phyllis Sinclair for her expert care, proven experience and professional knowledge. Phyllis is committed to providing the highest level of service and guidance from start to finish. After over 30 years in real estate, she is recognized in Who's Who in North American Real Estate,Top Pro, Denver Metro Association of Realtor's Million Dollar Round Table, The Kentwood Company's Ten Million Dollar Club as well as receiving consecutive Five Star Professional Awards. Referrals and testimonials from present and past clients are key to Phyllis' success.  She is proud to have assisted three generations of families with one of their most significant financial and personal decisions.
title: Broker Associate, GRI, CRS

description:
With over 37 years of commercial real estate and development experience, Randy understands what sophisticated tenants and landlords demand and excels at delivering superior service and attention to his clients and their goals, imploring a personalized A to Z approach when working every transaction, no matter how big or small.

Randy was born and raised in Denver, CO and is a graduate of Colorado State University. He has been entrenched in the Denver Commercial Market for over 33 years as a top producer with several major commercial brokerage firms. His primary area of expertise is representing tenants and buyers along with an extensive background in development, market and financial analysis, site selection, marketing strategies, lease and sale negotiations, space programming along with over 25 years of institutional landlord representation. He has represented a myriad of Fortune 500 clientele and has completed in excess of $1B in sale and lease transactions.
title: Senior Commercial Advisor

description:
If you want to work with someone who is patient, analytical, protective, and fun loving, you found the right person. Randy cares deeply about his client's success and happiness.

Randy has a myriad of high level certifications (GRI, CRS, CLHMS) and degrees (BS Biology, MS Computer Science) because he loves to learn. He is a specialist in many faucets of real estate. Whether you are a first time home buyer, an investor, are retired, or you want to live on a horse property, Randy will be able to guide your through every stage of your life with care and expertise.

Randy settled in Colorado because he loves all things outdoors, from skiing and backpacking, to horseback riding to dirtbike riding. He loves to play golf, too.

Once you meet Randy, you will recognize his skill and caring. You will want him to be your real estate agent.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, GRI, CRS

description:
As the Managing Broker for Kentwood Cherry Creek, Rebecca Ferguson is committed to providing the elite group of Brokers she works with the very best leadership, support and guidance every day. With this, the Brokers from the Cherry Creek office are able to consistently provide their clients with a superior experience when buying or selling their homes.

Rebecca began her career as a real estate agent in Missouri with Realty Executives Fort Leonard Wood and was awarded the Top Agent award the first two years in a row. In 2017, she transitioned to the Managing Broker and was able to share her knowledge of building a successful real estate business with her agents. In this role, Rebecca learned that leading and developing real estate agents was a true passion of hers and led her office to be ranked within the top three Brokerages in that market.

Most recently, Rebecca served as a Success Coach with the Coldwell Banker Global Luxury office in Cherry Creek where she was able to continue to develop and train agents and focus on the luxury real estate market in Denver.

Originally from San Diego, CA, Rebecca graduated from the University of California Santa Barbara and moved to Denver in 1999. Following 20 years of moving as an Army spouse, she was able to again call Denver her home in 2020. She is thrilled to be back in beautiful Colorado and a part of the Kentwood Real Estate team!
title: Managing Broker Kentwood Cherry Creek, Realtor®

description:
Trusted * Compassionate * Integrity

As a trusted, and compassionate, real estate agent, Renita puts her client's needs above everything else. Through hard work, knowledge, kindness, and integrity, she makes sure every transaction is completed with detailed focus and continued communication throughout the process.

She works to exceed expectations with everyone she works with.

A little bit about how she got into real estate:

As her family came to America, her father became friends with a gentleman on the journey. Her father asked him what is the best way to make a good living for my family in America? The gentleman replied, "real estate", and the rest is history. Renita learned from her parents at a very young age what real estate is all about.

In August 1988, at the age of 25, she bought her first property, a duplex. She lived in one half and rented the other half. That was the beginning of her real estate career. Since then, she bought, sold, managed, and held investment properties. Several years ago, she changed from investor to helping folks achieve their vision of home ownership.

The things that light up her life are the relationships, guiding folks through complicated real estate transactions, and learning all things real estate.

“I get to learn all I can about the market and all areas of real estate so I can be the best possible resource for YOU!  Let’s say I “nerd out” about these things so you don’t have to.”

I love all things wine – exploring different flavors and socializing.

I love to read – the best way to relax and enjoy a good story.

I love cooking – it’s my favorite way to show my creative side.

I love traveling – experiencing and emersion into new cultures.

Some people may be surprised to learn that I am a retired pharmacist, I have a twin sister and speak fluent German.

Are we a good fit?

* A member of DMAR (Denver Metro Association of Realtors), CAR (Colorado Association of Realtors), NAR (National Association of Realtors, LPI (Luxury Portfolio International)

* A certified real estate negotiator (CREN)

*Areas of expertise are new builds, 1031 exchange and HUD homes

*Specialize in all cities on the west side of Denver from Arvada, Golden to Roxborough, Colorado Springs and Pueblo
title: Realtor®, CREN, ABR

description:
Licensed in 2004, Rob and his team at The GHS Group have helped nearly 1,000 Colorado residents and entities buy and sell homes. Growing up in the Denver Metro area, Rob has extensive knowledge of the many different neighborhoods that make Denver so unique. He also knows what it takes to deliver unparalleled results to his clients in one of the country’s most competitive real estate markets. Rob has consistently been one of the top-producing Realtors in the Denver area and his overall production puts him in the top 1% of all real-estate agents in Colorado.

Rob graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder and is actively involved in the community, including the Marlee’s Smile Foundation and Camp Wapiyapi. In his free time, he enjoys spending time in the mountains and on the golf course with his friends and family. Previously, as head golf coach for Lutheran High School in Parker, he led the boys' team to two consecutive state tournament appearances.

Rob possesses a tremendous drive to be the best in the industry, and has achieved this through extremely high standards for customer service, a far-reaching referral network, and an extensive knowledge of the real estate market within Denver and the surrounding suburbs. From new-construction to resale; corporate relocation to investment properties, Rob gets to exercise his passion of helping clients buy and sell real estate on a daily basis.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor ®

description:
Who is Robyn Landry?

Wife, hiker, traveler, walker, camper, bicycler, reader and... tough negotiator, thorough market analyzer, lover (and renovator) of older homes, remodel consultant, stress reducer, holder of hands, part-time psychologist, researcher, services reference guide, copy writer, tour guide and Real Estate Agent for happy and satisfied clients!
 

Let me tell you how I work...

I have experience selling residential homes & condominiums, investment properties and commercial office buildings - in all price ranges.

My largest single source of business comes from satisfied clients who have referred me to their friends & family members.

My business is built on providing energetic, quality, honest & ethical service.

I provide professional, thorough attention & follow-thru on contract details.

I assume that most problems are fixable & search for mutually agreeable solutions.

I will keep you informed & will be available when needed.

Robyn puts people & houses together...
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Roy has over 40 years of experience in the Denver metro area with the emphasis of “Clients first, always”. When he meets with you to discuss your real estate needs, he listens to what is important to you and your family and makes your wish a reality.

When selling or purchasing a home, it’s more than simply initiating the customized marketing plan, or having a list of homes to view.  It’s about listening to our clients, and the subtleties and unspoken needs that sometimes makes a difference in purchasing the right home or selling a home. You want what is best for you and your family, and we deliver on what is important to you and your family. 

Choosing the right professional to represent you is an important decision that could affect your future real estate investment and resale. Having assisted over 1,900 families, Roy guides you through your customized path in making the right decisions, and with great care.

Roy continues to be one of Denver’s top Realtors for over 40 years, and we encourage you to check the Testimonials from Roy’s clients. He has a proven track record and has been awarded the Five Star Real Estate Agent for 11 consecutive years: 2011 to 2021. Roy was named Realtor of the Year for 2016 through AAR and was Broker Associate of the Month for the Denver Metro area, by the Broker magazine.

Roy believes in giving back to the community. The Helen Phelps award recognizes one outstanding volunteer in the Denver Public School system for their contribution towards education at their annual award through the Denver Teachers foundation. Roy received the Helen Phelps award in 2019 for his involvement in funding initiatives for North High School. Roy strongly believes that education is key to effectuating change in yourself and your community.  Roy holds a 5-year degree in Architecture & Environmental Design from the University of Nebraska–Lincoln.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
JULIE AND SALLIE

Julie and Sallie are described by their clients as providing uncompromising dedication to their clients’ interests, attention to detail and the highest level of integrity. They are third generation Colorado natives who are very familiar with the neighborhoods in the Denver metropolitan area, especially the central Denver neighborhoods and the southeast suburbs including Cherry Hills and Greenwood Village.

Julie and Sallie have consistently been recognized as top ranking brokers by the Denver Metro Association of Realtors. As a team, they are formidable. They provide twice the enthusiasm, twice the creative marketing skills, twice the real estate knowledge, twice the professionalism, and twice the dedication to their clients.

Prior to joining Kentwood, Julie and Sallie were founding owners of the highly successful Fuller Towne and Country Properties and were instrumental in the company’s management, development and later sale.

They enjoy working with buyers and sellers in all price ranges from lower downtown to Castle Pines and everywhere in between.


ABOUT SALLIE

Sallie graduated from University of Colorado in Boulder with an undergraduate degree in marketing. She then attended Georgetown University Law School in Washington, DC. She has been a licensed attorney in Colorado since 1989 specializing in representing individuals and businesses in buying, selling, leasing and developing real property throughout the country.

In 1997, Sallie decided to take her real estate law expertise and her negotiation skills to the sales side of the real estate arena, where she has been highly successful and achieved exceptional results for her clients.

Sallie lives in Cherry Hills Village with her husband and three children.

ABOUT JULIE

Julie is a graduate of the University of Colorado in Boulder with an undergraduate degree in English.

Julie started in Residential Real Estate in 1989. She is a member of the Denver Metro Association of Realtors and has earned a Graduate Realtor Institute designation. 

While committed to her real estate career, Julie also enjoys many things Colorado has to offer. Being actively involved in many community opportunities Julie thinks it is important to give back to the community in which you live.

She also enjoys skiing, spending time with friends and family, tennis and volunteering at her daughter's school to support her in her education and extra-curricular activities and sports.
title: Broker Associates, Realtors®

description:
SANDY HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED FOR HER SUCCESS AND PERFORMANCE ORIENTED RESULTS PRODUCED FOR HER CLIENTS.
Sandy Weigand is a highly motivated career individual with forty years of experience in Denver residential real estate. She strives for excellence to consistently provide the greatest expertise and knowledge to afford the finest client services available in todayís demanding and challenging marketplace. Her ability to listen, absorb, analyze and move forward in your best interest is indicative of her strong client base which primarily consists of repeat business and referrals from her past clients. As the ultimate professional, she attributes her success to market knowledge, superior and competitive marketing, integrity, respect of her clientís privacy, strong proven negotiation skills and most of all her genuinely caring attitude toward her clients.

She will be there for you throughout the transaction while understanding her job does not end at the closing table. Her vast knowledge and experience extend throughout Cherry Hills Village, Greenwood Village, Denver and Douglas Counties.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
After spending the last 33 years in the Denver area, Sara is proud to call herself an “almost-native “and loves the Denver area. An avid sports enthusiast, she has been involved in Martial Arts since 1979 and enjoys teaching and training. Cycling is another passion, and she believes there is no better way to enjoy the sights in Colorado than on a bike.

Sara carries that same passion into her career in real estate. Having spent the last 8 years working at Kentwood City Properties, she is proud of the Kentwood brand and what it represents. Sara is most proud of the relationships that she builds with her clients; she understands that great service means insightful communication and a passion for the process of turning the dream of homeownership into a wonderful reality.  Referrals and repeat clients are the cornerstone of Sara’s business, and that speaks volumes about the high level of satisfaction she achieves with every transaction.    

Sara lives in the Northwest Denver area, and loves the area for its eclectic mix of styles and great walkable neighborhoods. At the same time, she is well-versed in many neighborhoods including Park Hill, Mayfair, Congress Park, Wash Park and many others.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, CNE

description:
I am originally from the Chicago area but have lived in Northern Colorado most of my life. I graduated from Fort Collins High School and earned a Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering from CU Boulder and an MBA from Colorado State University. I started working at Woodward, Inc. when I was just 14 years old and grew in the company for the next 28 years, ultimately becoming the director of engineering. My background in engineering honed my problem-solving skills and instilled a strong work ethic that I have carried into my real estate endeavors.

While I became a real estate agent in 2015, my connection with real estate actually dates back to 1999 when I started investing in properties. Over the years, I've amassed a wealth of experience and skills that translate seamlessly into my work as an agent. I'm not just a real estate professional; I'm a hands-on home remodeler and a licensed general contractor with expertise in electrical work, plumbing, framing, tiling, roofing, and painting, among other essential skills. With my extensive professional background and strong project management skills, I can oversee the real estate process from start to finish, ensuring you get the best deal. My goal is to make the journey both smooth and enjoyable, helping you achieve your housing dreams, whether you're buying your first home or selling a property. Clients have described me as professional, knowledgeable, hardworking, trustworthy, personable, responsive, efficient, patient, and dedicated.

I'm happily married with three kids and a young step-daughter — plus our cat, Teacup. In my free time, I enjoy reading, playing tennis, skiing, biking, and just about any outdoor activity. I also have a passion for home renovation and love taking on projects that allow me to apply my skills and creativity. I'm a volunteer for the Red Cross, giving back to my community and making a positive impact where I can.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
Sarah Tyler is an experienced and passionate REALTOR®. She is a member of the Fort Collins Board of Realtors, a Colorado Native, and a Colorado State University Alumna. She and her husband Jon have two beautiful children, Maggie and Ian.  Sarah puts customer service at the forefront of her business and continues to form long-term relationships with Clients past working with them on their home sale/purchase. She is dedicated to making her individual client’s goals come true. Sarah Tyler specializes in working with both buyers and sellers in Northern Colorado. She develops a personal marketing plan customized for each individual client when selling their home and makes the buying and selling process enjoyable and easy. She always keeps in mind the client’s goals and the climate of the current market.

Areas of Focus and Expertise:

New Construction Homes
Luxury Homes
Land
Relocation
First Time Home Buyers
Customized Marketing for Sellers
Priority Focused Home Searches for Buyers
title: Managing Broker Kentwood Northern Properties, Realtor®

description:
Profile of a Professional - SCOTT SCHOLBE Broker Associate ' Relocation Specialist Since 1981, Scott Scholbe has been providing a brand of service that has earned him the respect of his clients and his peers. His soft sell approach to real estate focuses on what his buyers and sellers really want, listening with care and interest to what people tell him. When he is certain that he understands, Scott formulates a comprehensive plan to meet those specific needs and desires. Interested, individual attention is one of Scott's most consistent and valuable business assets. His easy-going and efficient way of doing business is always appreciated, as witnessed by a continual supply of personal referrals from individuals and corporate leaders with whom he has previously done business.

Most of Scott's business comes via referrals from past clients, social contacts and friends. He has the ability to match what people want with the best available properties. Working with this professional is a pleasure.

One of Scott's specialty areas is assisting corporate transfers moving to and from the Denver area. He has many things to offer buyers in their move
* A complete knowledge of Denver area communities and the different lifestyles they offer
* Continually updated information about home prices and values
* A thorough knowledge of new home availability, as well as his continually updated information about resale properties
* Information about schools, shopping, city lore, medical facilites, recreation and entertainment

Scott understands the intricacies of the corporate move and does everything possible to ensure that problems are minimized and that his buyers find the right home in the neighborhood that best suits their family's lifestyle.

For those moving from the Denver area, Scott provides two valuable services. First, his proven marketing program gets homes sold in a timely fashion and for top dollar. Second, Scott can introduce his clients to highly qualified real estate brokers across the country through The Kentwood Company's nationwide referral network, brokers who care just as much as he does about finding families the perfect home in the right neighborhood.

Helping local people sell one property in order to buy another is an addtional specialty of Scott's, carefully coordinating each transaction to make the transition a pleasant one. The same proven marketing plan that helps families moving away from the city gets the job done as well for those moving across the city.

A genuine interest in helping his buyers get what they want makes their search for a new residence an exciting adventure. Scott's awareness of Denver's real estate market is complete. Whether you are moving up, moving down or simply changing neighborhoods, Scott has the ability to match what you want with the best available properties.

A man at the top of his profession, Scott is recognized nationally in Who's Who in Real Estate and has been honored by the Denver Business Journal as one of Denver's top 50 real estate agents.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
With over 18 years of experience selling residential real estate, Scott is a true real estate professional. He believes in hard work and complete dedication to his clients’ needs. Since 2005, Scott has been creating lasting relationships and growing an exclusive referral & past client source of business. Scott is known for his patience, listening skills, negotiation skills, market knowledge and work ethic.

Scott lives with his wife and two boys in the Foxridge neighborhood in Centennial. Born in Livermore, California, Scott and his family moved seven times and lived in five different states, but he grew up mostly in the suburbs of Detroit, MI & Atlanta, GA. This constant moving gave Scott a unique appreciation for all that Colorado has to offer—which led him to Colorado State University. He graduated in 2000, moved to Denver and plans to never leave. Scott spends every bit of his spare time with his family…enjoying every minute of it.

Scott's approach to Real Estate
Hard Work—As a real estate agent, as in life, Scott feels hard work trumps all other characteristics. As your agent, Scott will work tirelessly for you and strive to be available when you need him.

Communication—Scott is dedicated to stay in constant contact with his clients. You will hear from him regularly with respect to all phases of the sale…appointments, feedback, market activity, you name it. You won’t have to track him down. He will be contacting you.

Expert Negotiation—Scott has strong negotiation skills and they have been honed through more than 11 years of experience and from acquiring the Negotiation Expert Certification. As a result, Scott is very effective in obtaining the results you desire.

Expert Market Knowledge —Scott’s clients always receive the latest stats and trends in the market because he stays on top of that information at all times. Hard work & experience in this area results in terrific feedback for his clients.

“Purchasing/selling a home is a major life event and my service will demonstrate that I get that. My goal is that you and I become a team…and we make the difficult task of purchasing or selling a home easy and enjoyable. Call or email me today to get started.”
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®, CNE

description:
Sean and Debbie are seasoned real estate professionals who truly believe their value to their clients has to be earned every day and know that the reputation they keep is only as good as their last client’s experience.  “Our commitment to our clients’ needs and welfare is all that lasts when the job is completed.  Our successes don’t mean anything until the clients know they can trust us and we always aim to never let them down.  We are committed to never taking our clients’ sacred bond of trust for granted.  Our philosophy of business is to exceed our client’s expectations.”

Sean and Debbie have never believed that they can best service their clients by specializing in a single segment of the market but rather adapting to the changing market conditions and needs of their clients.  Their business has been almost exclusively referral and repeat clients for many years.  The formula that has led to their success is an extensive knowledge of current market conditions and listening closely to what their clients are ultimately trying to achieve.  Whether it’s representing buyers to find that “perfect” home in the perfect neighborhood to listing and marketing a seller’s home, the goal remains the same – helping their clients achieve their goals.

After graduating from the University of Rhode Island and attaining a Master’s in Education from Boston University, Debbie returned to her native roots of Colorado to teach special education.  However, Real Estate was in her blood and she embarked on creating a successful Real Estate career in 2001.  Raised in Colorado, Sean is a proud Graduate of Creighton University, Marquette University and the University of Denver.  Prior to working with Debbie, Sean spent 10 years working as a Civil Engineer for a local Colorado Company.  Debbie’s successes led to new opportunities and Sean left engineering to help Debbie leverage her opportunities in 2005.  “I never expected to find such enjoyment in a career.  Our successes are always our client’s successes and I look forward to meeting these lofty aspirations in the future.”  Their diverse educational and professional experiences only enhance their expertise.
 
With over two decades of combined real estate experience, the Larkin team are full service brokers who stay up on market trends and the latest technology to make transactions and communication with clients seamless.   Sean and Debbie have been recognized in the Denver Metro area by The Denver Business Journal in the “Who’s Who in Denver Business” issue and Million Dollar Round Table awards.  “We feel it is important to know the market and listen to buyers, sellers fellow brokers in order to adapt a marketing strategy specific to each individual party and property.”

Sean and Debbie live in Cherry Hills and have two children, Kaitlin and Connor.  Having children themselves, and working with numerous families with young children has made them extraordinarily knowledgeable about the various school systems in the Denver area. They welcome the opportunity to discuss a family’s educational goals simultaneously to their wants and needs in terms of a new home.
title: Broker Associates, Realtors ®

description:
Sean Kelly is a fourth-generation Colorado Native who shares his wide-range of knowledge of the Denver Metro area to guide his clients looking to make Denver their home. Graduating from the University of Colorado LEEDs School of Business with an emphasis in finance, Sean has a unique combination of business acumen and understanding of the wants and needs of his clients.

Now in his 20th successful year in sales, Sean has earned a reputation for his honesty and integrity. He has negotiated and closed over 1000 transactions through the fluctuating Denver market, some in tandem with his teammate/father, Bob Kelly. He also has extensive experience with new construction sales.  Sean has been recognized annually by the Denver Board of Realtors (2003-present) and The Kentwood Company 10 Million Dollar Club (2007-present).

“I genuinely enjoy this business because I have the opportunity to help people achieve their real estate goals. Every client and transaction is different, and it allows me to facilitate two decades of experience to work on my client’s behalf to either help them sell their home for top dollar or find the perfect home. Eighty percent of my business comes from repeat clients and referrals, so giving my clients the best experience and outcome possible is my priority.”

Sean and his wife, Jenna, enjoy raising their two children, Finnegan (6) and Molly Mae (3). They love spending time outdoors, rooting on all Denver sports teams and being involved within the community. Sean's hobbies include playing, golf, softball, basketball, hiking and traveling.
title: Broker Associate, Realtor®

description:
People have always gravitated towards me for help and advice, and I love to provide whatever I can.  I’m an observant problem solver that gets things done.  I bring a level-headed approach to business and negotiations, making complex situations simple and providing luxury-level service to all my clients.  Just the skills that will help you navigate the process of home buying and selling.

I love to read and can’t fall asleep at night before finishing a few chapters in my latest book.  Learning is a passion and if I don’t know the answer, I know where to find it.  I joined Kentwood Real Estate because of their reputation and resources. This gives me the opportunity to learn from countless experienced brokers.  The network of professionals that I’ve built will help guide you to the best solutions.

Things I love:

Family- laughing, eating, talking and just hanging out with my husband of over 30 years and 3 grown children who make me proud everyday.

Nature- long walks through various Denver neighborhoods, hiking through gorgeous Colorado, skiing on a bluebird day.

Creating- cooking, crafts, home design, art and architecture.

Tidbits about me:

My husband and I built a wholesale jewelry business together (IsArt) and it’s still going strong after 30 years (and so are we).

I lived in Israel for 4 years, am a citizen and speak Hebrew.  I attended Cornell, Tel Aviv University and the School of Visual Arts.

After having dogs my whole life, I have a cat named Kets that thinks he’s a dog.

Community service has also always been a priority, whether volunteering in my children’s schools or supporting Planned Parenthood, Jewish Family Service, Food Bank of the Rockies, JStreet, and Women’s Foundation of Colorado.  My latest passion is Shared Power from Project I See You which raises money for grants to help under-privileged Women and children attain home ownership.

If I sound like your kind of realtor; let’s grab coffee and talk about how I can help you achieve your Home-owning dreams.

--------------------------------
